0.title: Elon Musk is planning to build his own private airport in Texas: Report
0.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk is reportedly planning to build his own private airport in Texas. As per the report, the airport will be used by Musk and his executives. Musk has based several of his companies, including SpaceX and The Boring Company, in Texas, and moved his Tesla headquarters from Silicon Valley to Texas in December.

1.title: Pelosi has right to visit Taiwan, China needn't turn it into a conflict: US
1.article_body: The White House has warned China against turning US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's potential visit to Taiwan into a "crisis or conflict", saying Pelosi "has the right to visit Taiwan". The White House also warned China might respond to Pelosi's mooted visit to Taiwan with military provocations, including by firing missiles near Taiwan. China claims Taiwan as its own territory.

2.title: Love it when people think 'She's so dumb', memes add to my popularity: Alia
2.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that she loves it when people think that she is unintelligent or that "Oh, she is so dumb". "They make so many memes on me which add to [my] popularity...I also want to put out this message for young girls...general knowledge and bookish intelligence in my opinion is not intelligence," she added.

3.title: In-laws harass woman for not giving birth to boy in Pune; FIR filed
3.article_body: Pune's Chinchwad police have filed an FIR against a 28-year-old woman's in-laws for allegedly harassing and molesting her for not giving birth to a boy, officials said on Monday. The woman rushed to police to file a complaint following an incident on July 29, wherein she was apparently grabbed by her hair, beaten, verbally abused and molested by her in-laws.

4.title: I don't take this seriously: Kareena on 'Boycott Laal...' Twitter trend
4.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has reacted to the Twitter trend calling for a boycott of her upcoming movie 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Everyone has an opinion...if that is going to be there, then you have to learn to ignore certain things," she stated. Kareena added, "Otherwise, it'll...become impossible to live your life...that's why I don't take any of this like seriously."

5.title: I worked in many factories, tea stalls when I was young: Sudesh Lehri
5.article_body: Comedian Sudesh Lehri, recalling his childhood, revealed that he had circumstances when he was in poverty. "I used to work in small shops when I was young. I've worked in...many factories, tea stalls," he stated. Sudesh added he used to "quietly" have some tea before giving it to factory workers as there were days he couldn't have tea at home.

6.title: I've written to Tom Hanks if he's free & would watch 'Laal...': Aamir
6.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan revealed that he has written to Hollywood actor Tom Hanks if he would like to watch 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The film is an official remake of Hanks' 'Forrest Gump'. "I've written to him if he's free...would like to watch the film. I have got feedback from his team that they're seeing his schedule for that," he stated.

7.title: Burglars drill hole in wall of jewellery shop in Pune, steal ornaments
7.article_body: Burglars stole gold ornaments worth ₹2.96 lakh by drilling a hole in the wall of a jewellery shop in Pune's Undri, police said. They entered the premises of a school, adjacent to the shop, and drilled a hole in the common wall, police added. The burglars also stole the digital video recorder in which the CCTV footage was captured.

8.title: Who was al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri killed in US drone strike in Afghanistan?
8.article_body: Al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri, 71, was a key architect behind multiple assaults on the US and was "deeply involved" in the planning of the September 11, 2001 attacks that killed 3,000 people. Born in 1951, he grew up in Egypt's upper-class neighbourhood. Zawahiri, a trained surgeon, became al Qaeda's leader after Osama bin Laden was killed in 2011.

9.title: Suryakumar, Avesh wear Arshdeep’s jersey in 2nd T20I against West Indies, pics go viral
9.article_body: India cricketers Suryakumar Yadav and Avesh Khan were seen wearing Arshdeep Singh's jersey during the second T20I against West Indies. This came after the match was postponed twice due to logistics issues, with luggage not arriving on time. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "How many extra jerseys does he have?" Another tweet read, "Why are everyone wearing Arshdeep's jersey?"

10.title: Partha Chatterjee not cooperating, often complaining of tiredness: ED
10.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said that ex-West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the federal anti-money laundering agency in school job scam, has not been cooperating with sleuths. "He is often complaining of tiredness and avoiding our questions," an ED official told PTI. He remained silent most of the time during the questioning, the central probe agency added.

11.title: West Indies' McCoy breaks record for best-ever bowling figures against India in a T20I
11.article_body: West Indies pacer Obed McCoy has broken the record for best-ever T20I bowling figures against India. McCoy registered figures of 4-1-17-6 to set the record. Prior to him, no bowler had even taken a five-wicket haul against India in T20I cricket. McCoy's figures against India are also the best-ever T20I figures by a West Indies bowler.

12.title: Who are India's gold medal contenders at CWG 2022 for today?
12.article_body: India's Seema Punia and Navjeet Kaur Dhillon will participate in women's discus throw final on Day 5 of CWG 2022. India will face Malaysia in gold medal match of badminton mixed team event at 10 pm. India's lawn bowls women's fours final match will begin at 4.15 pm. India's table tennis men's team gold match will begin at 6 pm.

13.title: Violation of withdrawal agreement: Taliban as US strike in Kabul kills al-Qaeda chief
13.article_body: After the US announced that it has killed Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri in a drone strike in Afghanistan over the weekend, Taliban condemned it as a violation of "international principles" and the 2020 agreement on US troop withdrawal. Taliban spokesperson Zabihullah Mujahid said in a statement that the attack took place in Kabul on Sunday.

14.title: Air India brings new policy to allow pilots to fly till 65 amid fleet expansion
14.article_body: Air India has introduced a new policy wherein selected pilots will be given an extension of five years on a contract basis after their retirement amid the airline increasing number of aircraft in its fleet. While currently, the pilots retire at 58 at the company, the contract can be extended till the age of 65 years.

15.title: I have faced 'extreme misogyny' and 'casual sexism': Alia Bhatt
15.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she has faced "casual sexism" and "extreme misogyny" in the past, which has made her much more sensitive. "Sometimes my friends go like '...why have you become so aggressive?'" added Alia. "It's...just random things like 'don't be so sensitive'...are you PMSing. To hell with you...and even if I am PMSing so the hell what?" she stated.

16.title: Bengaluru reports 992 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
16.article_body: Bengaluru reported 992 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,37,060 cases in the city, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Monday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall death toll remained at 16,975. The number of active cases was 8,325, while the infection positivity rate stood at 7.45%.

17.title: Loudspeaker which rang everyday at 8 am has stopped: Maharashtra CM
17.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday, without taking anyone's name, said the "loudspeaker" which rang everyday at 8 am is now stopped. "Hey, is...sound coming? Fix that loudspeaker. There'll be no sound," Shinde said. Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut was arrested by ED on Sunday night after questioning in relation with alleged money laundering linked to redevelopment of a Mumbai chawl.

18.title: Locals protest as minister says B'luru will be free of stray dogs
18.article_body: Weeks after Minister of Animal Husbandry Prabhu Chauhan said that Bengaluru will soon be free of stray dogs, locals held a protest at Freedom Park against the statement on Sunday. Calling the minister's claim misleading, Sujata Prasanna, a member of Action for Animal Justice, said there is no facility in the city that can accommodate lakhs of dogs.

19.title: Woman, 7-yr-old son returning from hospital run over by BEST bus, killed
19.article_body: A 27-year-old woman and her seven-year-old son were killed after being run over by a Brihanmumbai Electric Supply & Transport (BEST) bus on Monday. Woman had taken her son to Sion hospital as he was suffering from cold, fever and cough for last two days. Reports said the victims did not see bus as it took sudden turn on road.

20.title: Who won medals for India at CWG 2022 on Day 4?
20.article_body: India won three medals on Day 4 of CWG 2022. Judoka Shushila Devi clinched a silver medal in the women's 48-kg category, becoming the first Indian to win multiple medals in judo in CWG history. Meanwhile, judoka Vijay Kumar Yadav bagged bronze in the men's 60-kg category. Weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bagged bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category.

21.title: No matter where you hide, US will find you and take you out: Biden to terrorists
21.article_body: US President Joe Biden said, "No matter where you hide, if you're a threat to our people, the United States will find you and take you out." He added, "We shall never waver from defending our nation and its people." Biden's statement came as he announced that Al-Qaeda's Ayman al-Zawahiri had been killed in a CIA drone strike in Afghanistan.

22.title: Estee Lauder in talks to acquire Tom Ford for $3 billion or more: Report
22.article_body: Cosmetics company Estee Lauder is in talks to acquire luxury brand Tom Ford in what could be a $3 billion or more deal, as per a report. If the deal goes through, it will be Estee Lauder's biggest acquisition ever. Tom Ford is known for its menswear and also has women's wear, cosmetics and handbags as part of its products.

23.title: Thane girl who scored 81.60% in SSC despite battling cancer passes away
23.article_body: Divya Pavale from Thane, who scored 81.60% despite battling cancer during her SSC exams this year, passed away on Monday evening. Reports said that Divya was undergoing chemotherapy even a few days before her practical exams. A trustee of her school said that she was a happy-go-lucky girl and was going through a difficult phase for last few days.

24.title: Delhi to launch mobile health check-ups for workers at construction sites
24.article_body: Delhi government has decided to set up mobile health check-ups and creche facilities for workers at construction sites. The 'Doctors on Wheels' scheme will arrange for mobile vans in every district to visit various construction sites for routine health check-ups, the government said. The mobile creches will be set up for children of construction workers at work sites, it added.

25.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India win 9 medals?
25.article_body: India have bagged a total of nine medals at CWG 2022 so far and are placed sixth on the medal standings after Day 4. Australia lead the standings with 31 gold medals, followed by England (21) and New Zealand (13). As many as 26 nations/territories have clinched at least one medal at CWG 2022 so far.

26.title: WI take all 10 wickets vs India in a T20I for 1st time in history, level series 1-1
26.article_body: West Indies defeated India by five wickets in the second T20I to level the five-match series 1-1. Bowling first, West Indies dismissed India for 138 runs in 19.4 overs. This is the first time in men's T20I cricket history that West Indies took all 10 wickets against India in an innings. West Indies chased down the target in 19.2 overs.

27.title: Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri killed in US drone strike in Afghanistan
27.article_body: Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri was killed in a drone strike by the US' CIA in Afghanistan on Sunday, President Joe Biden said. Zawahiri was a key plotter of the 9/11 terrorist attacks and took over as leader of the group after Osama bin Laden's death in 2011. "Justice has been delivered, and this terrorist leader is no more," Biden said.

28.title: Weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bags bronze, wins India's 9th medal at CWG 2022
28.article_body: Indian weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bagged bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category, taking India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to nine. Harjinder lifted a total of 212 kg, with 93 kg in snatch and 119 kg in clean and jerk. Out of India's nine medals at CWG 2022 so far, seven have come from weightlifting.

29.title: Defending champions India qualify for badminton mixed team gold medal match at CWG 2022
29.article_body: Defending champions India have qualified for the badminton mixed team gold medal match at CWG 2022. With this, India are assured of another medal. India defeated Singapore 3-0 in the semi-final of the event.  India will face Malaysia in the final on Tuesday. India have so far bagged eight medals at CWG 2022, including three gold medals.

30.title: India draw 4-4 vs England, concede 3 goals in 4th quarter in CWG men's hockey
30.article_body: Indian men's hockey team was held to a 4-4 draw against England in their second Pool B match at the Commonwealth Games on Monday. India were 4-1 ahead before England scored three goals in the fourth quarter. During the match, India reached a milestone of 100 goals in Commonwealth Games history following Mandeep Singh's goal in the 22nd minute.

31.title: Arunachal suspends residential proof certificates in Changlang
31.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh government on Monday issued an order suspending all residential proof certificates (RPC) issued in the Changlang district of the state. RPCs have been issued to members of the Chakma and Hajong communities who are yet to get Indian citizenship. This comes after students' body AAPSU threatened a strike over RPCs being issued to the two communities in Changlang.

32.title: Death toll due to floods in eastern Uganda rises to 24
32.article_body: The death toll due to the floods triggered by torrential rains in eastern Uganda reached 24 on Monday, authorities and Ugandan Red Cross informed. Uganda's government had confirmed 10 deaths due to the flooding in parts of Bugisu, Mbale and Kapchorwa on Sunday. 21 bodies have been recovered from Mbale and another three from Kapchorwa, Ugandan Red Cross told media.

33.title: Fintech startup Tartan raises $4.5 mn in pre-Series A round
33.article_body: Payroll management startup Tartan has raised $4.5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The round saw participation from 500 Global, InfoEdge Ventures, Naval Ravikant-backed AngelList Quant Fund, WorldQuant Ventures, Varanium GenNext Fund, 9 Unicorns, Yatra Angel Network, Emphasis Ventures (EMVC) and Naveen Kukreja. Tartan was founded in 2021 and has raised $6 million.

34.title: Inmates in Meerut jail make flags for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
34.article_body: Ahead of the 75th Independence Day, inmates of Meerut district jail have been making the national flags for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. Jail superintendent Rakesh Kumar said that 30 male and 10 female inmates are making the flags. He further added that the national flag will be hoisted in all 39 barracks of the jail as part of the campaign.

35.title: TaxBuddy parent firm SSBA Innovations files ₹105 cr IPO papers
35.article_body: SSBA Innovations, which runs tax portal TaxBuddy, has filed papers with market regulator SEBI to raise ₹105 crore through an Initial Public Offering (IPO). As per the Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP), the IPO will be an entirely fresh issue of shares. The fintech company was incorporated in 2017 and owns two platforms — TaxBuddy and Finbingo.

36.title: Sushila Devi's CWG 2022 silver can start a big movement: Charu Sharma
36.article_body: Following Indian judoka Sushila Devi's silver medal at Commonwealth Games 2022, commentator Charu Sharma tweeted, "India's northeast has massive martial arts potential in the lighter weights. Sushila Devi proves it with a rare silver in Judo. Could start a big movement." The 27-year-old from Manipur won silver in 48 kg category on Monday in Birmingham.

37.title: Elon feels he's behind schedule, is frustrated with his progress: Father Errol Musk
37.article_body: Elon Musk's father Errol has said that his billionaire son "feels like he's behind schedule", adding, "Where he is now, he would have liked to have been there five years ago." He added that the SpaceX CEO is "not as happy as he'd like to be", adding, "He is frustrated with (his) progress and it's understandable."

38.title: Kohli would be amazing to adventure with: Grylls on who he wants on Man vs Wild
38.article_body: On being asked who he would like to have on his show 'Man vs Wild', British adventurer Bear Grylls said, "Virat Kohli would be amazing to adventure with, a true heart of a lion and kind spirit." Grylls has earlier hosted Prime Minister Narendra Modi, actors Rajinikanth and Ranveer Singh and other Indian celebrities on the show.

39.title: Sri Lanka's Navy rescues 6 Indian fishermen stranded in its waters
39.article_body: Sri Lanka's Navy on Monday rescued six Indian fishermen after their boat developed a mechanical snag and drifted into the country's territorial waters. The Indian boat's owner was contacted by the Sri Lankan Navy, ANI reported. The owner then dispatched a rescue vessel from Rameswaram that brought back the stranded boat and its crew, the report added.

40.title: Ukraine confirms latest delivery of rocket systems from Germany, US
40.article_body: Ukraine's defence minister on Monday confirmed the latest delivery of German and US-made multiple rocket launcher systems to the country. Ukraine has received four HIMARS rocket launchers as part of the latest weapons aid, he said. He also announced on Twitter, "The third brother in the Long Hand family - MLRS MARS II from Germany - has arrived in Ukraine."

41.title: Nigerian man tests positive for monkeypox in Delhi, 6th case in India
41.article_body: A Nigerian man in his 30s has tested positive for monkeypox in Delhi, hospital officials said on Monday. This is the second case of the virus in the national capital and the sixth in India. The man had no recent foreign travel history, officials of the LNJP hospital, where he was admitted, said. India today confirmed its first monkeypox death.

42.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against West Indies
42.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the second T20I in St Kitts. India have made one change to their playing XI, with leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi being replaced by Avesh Khan. Meanwhile, West Indies have made two changes to their playing XI. The match was delayed due to logistics issues.

43.title: 28-year-old man dies in AC explosion in Chennai
43.article_body: A 28-year-old Chennai man died after an air conditioner exploded in his house on Sunday night. A loud noise was heard from the deceased's room on Sunday night, following which his father and brother rushed to the spot, reports said. They broke the door open and found the deceased's body inside the room, reports added.

44.title: Bill introduced in Aus parliament to lift ban on assisted suicides
44.article_body: A bill proposing the reversal of a ban on doctor-assisted suicide in two Australian territories was introduced in the country's parliament on Monday. It seeks to legalise assisted suicide in the Northern Territory and Australian Capital Territory. In 1995, Northern Territory became world's first place to legalise voluntary euthanasia. The law was later overturned in 1997 by Australia's parliament.

45.title: Vijay Kumar Yadav clinches bronze in judo, takes India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to 8
45.article_body: Indian judoka Vijay Kumar Yadav bagged a bronze medal in men's 60-kg category at CWG 2022. With this, he took India's medal tally at CWG to eight. It is India's second medal in judo at the ongoing games after Shushila Devi's silver. India have bagged three gold medals, three silver medals and two bronze medals at CWG 2022 so far.

46.title: Oppn raising issue of price rise due to Modi-phobia: BJP in LS
46.article_body: While defending the Central government over the issue of price rise, BJP on Monday asked the Opposition to get over "Modi-phobia", adding that people should appreciate PM Modi for his handling of the COVID-19 situation. BJP member Nishikant Dubey said India is the only country which is exporting rice, wheat and sugar under the leadership of PM Modi.

47.title: Delhi reports 822 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate highest in 6 months at 11.41%
47.article_body: Delhi reported 822 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Monday and the positivity rate rose to 11.41%, which is the highest in the last six months. The national capital also reported two deaths in the last 24 hours. Delhi saw 1,263 fresh COVID-19 cases on Sunday, while the positivity rate stood at 9.35%.

48.title: Unlike in past, drug smuggling doesn't go undetected now: BJP
48.article_body: The BJP on Monday criticised Rahul Gandhi for his criticism of the government over the recovery of drugs at Gujarat's Mundra port, adding that unlike in the past, drug consignments don't go undetected now. BJP national spokesperson Sambit Patra also dubbed Gandhi a "vacation politician", alleging that the Congress leader doesn't go into the depth of any issue.

49.title: He'll remain at no. 3: Jaffer on Kohli's batting spot for T20 WC 2022
49.article_body: Talking about India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, beginning October 16, Wasim Jaffer said batter Virat Kohli will remain in his original number three spot. "KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma should open...other players like Rishabh Pant, Sanju Samson and Ishan Kishan can contribute significantly to the squad," he added. Kohli has been rested for ongoing India-West Indies limited-overs series.

50.title: No need to create issue: Bihar minister as boy gets 151 out of 100 marks
50.article_body: After a college student in Bihar's Darbhanga was awarded 151 marks in a 100-mark paper, state Education minister Vijay Kumar Choudhary said it must have been a mistake and there was no need to create an issue. "There would be some misfeeding in the system or a typing error. We'll find out the person responsible for this," he said.

51.title: Bulgaria to hold snap poll on Oct 2; 4th parliamentary election in 2 years
51.article_body: Bulgaria's President Rumen Radev on Monday announced that the country will be holding an early parliamentary election on October 2. This comes following the collapse of former Prime Minister Kiril Petkov's coalition government after a no-confidence vote in June. The snap election will be Bulgaria's fourth parliamentary election in less than two years.

52.title: Shushila wins silver, becomes 1st Indian to bag multiple medals in judo in CWG history
52.article_body: Judoka Shushila Devi on Monday became the first-ever Indian to bag multiple medals in judo in the history of Commonwealth Games (CWG). The 27-year-old clinched silver at CWG 2022 after losing to Michaela Whitebooi of South Africa in the women's 48-kg category final. Shushila had bagged a silver medal at CWG 2014.

53.title: India has sufficient forex reserves; economic fundamentals are perfect: FM
53.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said India has sufficient foreign exchange reserves and India's economic fundamentals are perfect. Highlighting the strength of the Indian economy in the Parliament, Sitharaman said, "The government has acted to reduce cost of imports, drastically lowered duties on edible oils." No question of India slipping into stagflation or recession, she added.

54.title: India's Saurav Ghosal reaches men's singles semis in squash event at CWG
54.article_body: India's Saurav Ghosal entered the men's singles semi-final in the squash event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham. Ghosal beat Greg Lobban of Scotland 3-1 in the quarter-final match on Monday. The 35-year-old won with a scoreline of 11-5, 8-11, 11-7, 11-3. Ghosal will face New Zealand's Paul Coll in the semi-final on Tuesday.

55.title: India Accelerator announces new co-working space in Noida
55.article_body: India Accelerator, a startup accelerator, announced the launch of their new co-working space in Noida. The centre, spread across 20,000 sq. ft., has a capacity of 250 seats. The firm, which already has four co-working spaces in Gurugram has invested ₹2.75 crore in this space. The company said that within four years of its inception, it registered a 25x growth.

56.title: Income Tax Department sets new record as over 72 lakh ITRs filed in one day
56.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Monday said that a new record was set after taxpayers filed 72.42 lakh IT returns for FY22 on Sunday (July 31). About 5.83 crore ITRs for the financial year have been filed till July 31, the Department further said. The ITR deadline for salaried individuals wasn't extended for the first time in three years.

57.title: Indian economy better placed than most countries due to govt, RBI: FM
57.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said the Indian economy is better placed than most countries due to various measures taken by the government and the RBI. India remains the fastest growing economy in assessment of global agencies like International Monetary Fund and World Bank, Sitharaman said. Efforts are being made to bring down retail inflation below 7%, she added.

58.title: 2nd West Indies-India T20I delayed again, to now start at 11 pm
58.article_body: The second West Indies-India T20I has been delayed again and will now start at 11 pm (IST). The match, originally scheduled to begin at 8 pm (IST) was initially postponed by two hours because of significant delays in "crucial" team luggage arriving into St Kitts from Trinidad. India lead the five-match series 1-0.

59.title: Irani & daughter didn't own Goa bar, Congress leaders' claims malicious: Delhi HC
59.article_body: The Delhi High Court has ruled that Union Minister Smriti Irani and her daughter Zoish never owned the Goa restaurant which Congress leaders alleged had an illegal bar license. It further said that the leaders' statements were "in the nature of slander...with malicious intent". The leaders were directed to remove the social media posts in which the allegations were made.

60.title: 7 tourists from Punjab drown in Himachal Pradesh's Gobind Sagar lake
60.article_body: Seven tourists from Punjab's Mohali drowned in the Gobind Sagar lake in Himachal Pradesh's Una district on Monday. As per the State Disaster Management Department, a group of 11 tourists from Punjab entered the lake to take bath. Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur expressed grief over the incident.

61.title: Men's coach sits for Indian women's TT team match at CWG, sparks controversy
61.article_body: A controversy erupted after men's coach S Raman sat for Indian women's TT team quarter-final match against Malaysia at CWG 2022. "This shouldn't have happened, women's coach should've been guiding...players," said SD Mudgil, member of the Committee of Administrators running the suspended TTFI. After their defeat, the women's team also avoided media interaction, which is a standard protocol.

62.title: Efforts on to misuse central agencies to silence truth: Rahul on Raut's arrest
62.article_body: Efforts are on to misuse central agencies to break Opposition's morale and to silence the truth, Congress' Rahul Gandhi said while reacting to Enforcement Directorate's arrest of Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut. "'King's' message is clear - those who speak against me will suffer...But the tyrants must listen. In the end, 'truth' will win and ego will lose," Gandhi tweeted.

63.title: Kerala Startup Mission-backed Alibi gets NABL accreditation
63.article_body: Private forensics lab Alibi Global Private Limited, backed by Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM), has received accreditation from the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL). The accreditation is for a period of two years, according to a KSUM press release. The startup, which works exclusively in cyber forensics, is the first cyber forensics private lab in India.

64.title: Tribal areas in Himachal saw unprecedented growth under BJP: CM
64.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur said that the tribal and hard areas of the state saw unprecedented growth under the BJP government. Addressing a delegation of the Bharmour-Pangi area, he said that the state government made adequate budget allocation for tribal and backward areas. He alleged that the Congress government used the tribal people as a vote bank.

65.title: UP woman throws baby in front of tractor to stop it amid dispute
65.article_body: A woman in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda threw her baby in front of a tractor. The driver averted the mishap and stopped the tractor right in time. The incident occurred over a property dispute between two brothers and one tried to plough the other's field and claim possession. To avoid this, the wife of one of the brothers threw her infant.

66.title: NZ cyclist Ellesse stripped of CWG silver medal for not attending ceremony, fined ₹16,000
66.article_body: New Zealand cyclist Ellesse Andrews has been stripped of her silver medal that she bagged along with her teammates in the women's 4,000m team pursuit event. She won't get the medal as she did not attend the ceremony. She was also fined CHF 200 (more than ₹16,000). However, she went on to win two gold medals in two other events.

67.title: TN Police to engage IT students for cyber crime investigation
67.article_body: The Coimbatore Police will join hands with IT students, who are specialising in artificial intelligence and ethical hacking for the investigation of cyber crimes. The police have also planned to establish a 'Cyber Club', which will be used to create cyber awareness among common people. The club will educate common people about how to stay away from modern cyber crimes.

68.title: African swine fever reported in 2 districts of Kerala
68.article_body: New cases of swine fever were reported in Kerala's Wayanad and Kannur districts, district officials said. One case each has been reported in the districts and the Kannur District Collector scheduled a meeting. The Deputy Director of Animal Husbandry in Wayanad said that 193 pigs in and around Nenmeni village, where the disease was reported, will be culled this week.

69.title: Buy only 'Made in India' flags: Pune foundation to citizens
69.article_body: Volunteers of the Bharat Flag Foundation in Pune are asking citizens to not use China-made Indian flags over those made locally. Pamphlets were given to residents and shopkeepers, and they were asked to celebrate Independence Day using 'Made in India' flags. Purchasing these flags would indirectly support the Chinese economy, said Rahul Bhalerao, Executive President of the Foundation.

70.title: Pune district sees highest COVID-19 jab 1st dose coverage in Maha
70.article_body: Pune district reported 106.05% of the first COVID-19 vaccine dose coverage in Maharashtra, which is the highest in the state. State immunisation officer, Dr Sachin Desai, said initiatives like Har Ghar Dastak and free booster vaccination for 18 years and above have urged people to get immunised. Pune has the second highest second dose coverage across the state at 90.67%.

71.title: Indian gymnast Pranati Nayak finishes 5th in women's vault final at CWG
71.article_body: Indian gymnast Pranati Nayak finished fifth in women's vault final with an average score of 12.699 at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Pranati scored 13.633 in her first attempt and 11.766 in her second. Australia's Georgia Godwin won a gold medal after scoring 13.233 points. Canada's Laurie Denommee won silver, while Scotland's Shannon Archer won bronze.

72.title: ED's 8-yr record shows its targeting only Oppn leaders: CM Baghel
72.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday said the track record of the ED in the last eight years showed it was only targeting leaders of Opposition parties. "It is clear those who will speak against the Centre will face action. The agency never takes action in BJP-ruled states or against its leaders or BJP-supported organisations," CM Baghel said.

73.title: India's squash player Joshna Chinappa loses in quarter-final at CWG
73.article_body: India's Joshna Chinappa lost in the women's singles quarter-final against Canada's Hollie Naughton 0-3 in the squash event at CWG 2022 in Birmingham. She lost with a scoreline of 9-11, 5-11, 13-15 on Monday. Chinappa has never won a gold medal in singles event at CWG. She won a gold with Dipika Pallikal in women's doubles at CWG 2014.

74.title: Woman gangraped & filmed at rehab centre, forced into prostitution in Rishikesh
74.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly gangraped by two men at a drug rehabilitation centre in Uttarakhand's Rishikesh, as per a police complaint. The woman who runs the centre allegedly filmed the assault and blackmailed the complainant using the video to force her into prostitution. Police have filed a case and an investigation is underway.

75.title: Absolutely no chance of India going into recession: Finance Minister
75.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during a price rise debate in Parliament said there is "absolutely zero probability of India slipping into recession" or stagflation. "Pandemic, [COVID-19] second wave, Omicron, Russia-Ukraine (war)...in spite of [all this], we've held inflation within 7% or below. That has to be recognised," said Sitharaman. The Indian economy has recovered admirably, she said.

76.title: Congress MPs walk out of Lok Sabha as FM Sitharaman speaks on rising prices
76.article_body: Congress MPs walked out of the Lok Sabha as Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke on rising prices on Monday. "Pandemic, second wave, omicron, Russia-Ukraine (war)...even today largest supply components in China are under lockdown...in spite of that, we have held inflation well within 7% or below," she said. Sitharaman added that this has to be recognised.

77.title: RIL-owned logistics startup Grab.in integrates with ONDC
77.article_body: Reliance Retail owned logistics startup Grab.in has joined its platform with the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) network, a senior executive at the company said. The e-commerce platform is a subsidiary of Reliance Retail since its acquisitions by Reliance Industries in 2019. Prior to this, Reliance-backed Dunzo joined ONDC as a logistics partner.

78.title: US House Speaker Pelosi will visit Taiwan despite Chinese warnings: Reports
78.article_body: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi will visit Taiwan during her Asia tour, despite Chinese warnings, US media reported on Monday. The visit is definite, the Wall Street Journal reported, quoting a person familiar with the matter. China has said its military won't "sit idly by" if the top US official visits Taiwan, which it considers its own territory.

79.title: Made a mistake, forgive me: Maha Guv on 'Gujarati-Rajasthani' remark
79.article_body: Following criticism over his Gujarati-Rajasthani remarks, Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari on Monday said, "I have made a mistake." Last week, he had said, "If Gujaratis and Rajasthanis are removed from Maharashtra...no money would be left here." "I don't even imagine that if I made any mistake unintentionally...that mistake would be considered as an insult to...Maharashtra," he added.

80.title: Who were the top bidders as govt sells 5G spectrum for over ₹1.5 lakh crore?
80.article_body: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction concluded on Monday after seven days, with a total bid amount of ₹1,50,173 crore. Reliance Jio emerged the top bidder, acquiring 24,740 MHz spectrum worth ₹88,078 crore. Bharti Airtel acquired 19,867 MHz spectrum worth ₹43,084 crore. Vodafone Idea's bid was worth ₹18,799 crore, while Adani Group acquired 400 MHz spectrum worth ₹212 crore.

81.title: Indian IPO market for tech startups is nascent: Lightspeed's Somaia
81.article_body: Venture capital firm Lightspeed's de facto head of India operations, Bejul Somaia, in an interview said the IPO market for Indian tech companies is still nascent. Calling last year's tech IPOs a positive development, he said that the market still needed to deepen. With companies like Udaan, OYO, Razorpay, etc in its portfolio, Lightspeed recently closed a $500 million fund.

82.title: Centre forms special task force to monitor monkeypox cases
82.article_body: The Centre has formed a special task force to monitor monkeypox cases, officials said. The task force, which will be headed by NITI Aayog member (health) VK Paul, will also coordinate cases from states and provide any expertise that the states need. A 22-year-old man who had tested positive for monkeypox in the UAE died in Kerala's Thrissur on Saturday.

83.title: ED took action against Raut based on evidence: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
83.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said the ED's action against Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut was based on certain proofs and documents. "I would not comment on this issue further. His arrest and other related issues will be discussed in the court," said Fadnavis. Raut was arrested on Sunday night in connection with the Patra Chawl scam case.

84.title: TMC MP bites raw brinjal during Parliament debate on price rise, video released
84.article_body: TMC MP Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar on Monday bit on a raw brinjal during a Parliament debate on price rise. A video of the incident was released online, in which she's heard saying, "I'm talking about eating raw vegetables because LPG cylinder [price] has risen four times in four months." Government must understand what citizens are going through, she said.

85.title: Indian squash player Kuruvilla enters women's singles plate semis at CWG
85.article_body: Indian squash player Sunayna Kuruvilla beat Sri Lanka's Chanithma Sinaly 3-0 to reach the women's singles plate semi-final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Monday. Kuruvilla won the quarter-final match with a scoreline of 11-3, 11-2, 11-2. The 23-year-old will face Pakistan's Faiza Zafar on Tuesday. Zafar beat Guyana's Ashley Khalil 3-2 in the quarter-final.

86.title: Amber sells her home in US' California for $1.05 mn to pay Johnny Depp: Reports
86.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has reportedly sold her home in US' California after losing a defamation trial against ex-husband Johnny Depp in which she was ordered to pay him $8.3 million in damages. The property in Yucca Valley has been sold for $1.05 million (around ₹8.3 crore), reports said, adding that she bought it in 2019 for $5,70,000 (around ₹4.5 crore).

87.title: Have taken various steps to make India 'global drone hub' by 2030: Govt
87.article_body: The government has undertaken a series of reform measures to make India a global drone hub by 2030, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said on Monday. Singh added that the Drone Airspace Map was published on September 24, 2021, opening up nearly 90% of Indian airspace as green zone for drones flying up to 400 feet.

88.title: Boxer Hussamuddin enters quarters in 57 kg featherweight at CWG 2022
88.article_body: Indian boxer Mohammed Hussamuddin reached the quarter-final in men's 57 kg featherweight category at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Hussamuddin beat Bangladesh's Md Salim Hossain 5-0 in the round of 16. Earlier in the day, India's Amit Pangal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri 5-0 to enter the quarter-final in men's 51 kg flyweight category.

89.title: Zomato's consolidated loss nearly halves to ₹186 cr in Apr-Jun quarter
89.article_body: Zomato's consolidated net loss fell 47.8% YoY from ₹356.2 crore in Q1 FY22 to ₹185.7 crore in Q1 FY23. Zomato's consolidated revenue stood at ₹1,413.9 crore, rising by 67.44% YoY from ₹844.4 crore. Zomato CFO Akshant Goyal said growth in the food delivery platform's revenue was driven by a nearly 10% quarter-on-quarter growth in gross order value.

90.title: K'taka govt issues circular to check spread of monkeypox infection
90.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Sudhakar K on Monday said a circular has been issued to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike and all district administrations as a precautionary measure to check the spread of monkeypox infection. As per the circular, authorities have been asked to ensure enhanced surveillance, designated institutional isolation facilities, mandatory contact tracing and testing of samples.

91.title: Boxer Hussamuddin enters quarters in 57 kg featherweight at CWG 2022
91.article_body: Indian boxer Mohammed Hussamuddin reached the quarter-final in men's 57 kg featherweight category at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Hussamuddin beat Bangladesh's Md Salim Hossain 5-0 in the round of 16. Earlier in the day, India's Amit Pangal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri 5-0 to enter the quarter-final in men's 51 kg flyweight category.

92.title: There was never a minute when I had headache as Delhi Police chief: Asthana
92.article_body: Former Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana has said that there was never a minute when he had headache and wanted to quit the force. "Although I've retired today, I still believe I can do a lot more for the Delhi Police, the people and the country," he added. Senior IPS officer Sanjay Arora took charge as the new Commissioner.

93.title: 2nd West Indies-India T20I postponed by 2 hours as team luggage doesn't arrive on time
93.article_body: The second West Indies-India T20I has been postponed by two hours and is now scheduled to begin at 10 pm tonight, instead of 8 pm at Warner Park in St Kitts today. Cricket West Indies (CWI) said that the match has been postponed because of significant delays in "crucial" team luggage arriving into St Kitts from Trinidad.

94.title: Video of Paytm employees burning PhonePe's QR codes surfaces, police complaint lodged
94.article_body: UPI leader PhonePe filed a police complaint against some employees of Paytm, alleging that they burnt PhonePe's QR codes. The incident is said to have taken place in Greater Noida. A video of the incident has surfaced online. PhonePe said that it identified three Paytm employees, including an ex-PhonePe employee. Paytm said it suspended the employees pending a detailed investigation.

95.title: Raut is the Shiv Sainik who won’t bend: Uddhav on Raut’s arrest
95.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Monday said that he's proud of Sanjay Raut, adding that he's a real Shiv Sainik who won't bend. “There’s a dialogue in ‘Pushpa’ - “jhukega nahi”. Those who used to say they won’t bend are all that side today.” he said. Thackeray criticised the BJP for trying to muzzle the voices of dissent.

96.title: Delhi man intensifies crime to buy scooter for sister on Raksha Bandhan
96.article_body: A 21-year-old history-sheeter allegedly intensified his criminal activities in Delhi, so that he could buy an electric scooter for his sister on Raksha Bandhan, police said on Monday. With the accused's arrest, police claim to have solved six criminal cases, and also recovered three stolen mobile phones and a motorcycle from him.

97.title: B'luru to see regular power cuts in August due to maintenance work
97.article_body: Bengaluru is expected to witness regular power cuts throughout August due to maintenance work by Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited. According to Bengaluru's power distribution company BESCOM, the work will be undertaken nearly every day of the month from 9 am to 6 pm. As per BESCOM, its Koramangala, Indiranagar, Kanakapura and Whitefield divisions, among others, will be affected.

98.title: Teen dies after drowning in swimming pool in Hyderabad's Narsingi
98.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died on Sunday after drowning in a swimming pool at a gated community in Hyderabad's Narsingi, police informed. According to police, the boy was pulled out of the pool by his cousin who saw him struggling in the water on Saturday when they visited the pool. The teenager was later hospitalised but died during treatment, police added.

99.title: Realtor shot dead by business associate in Hyderabad's Madhapur
99.article_body: A real estate dealer named Mohammad Ismail was allegedly shot dead by his business associate over a suspected property dispute in Hyderabad's Madhapur area during the early hours of Monday. Police found in its preliminary probe that both the victim and the accused had several criminal cases registered against them. The accused and his associate are absconding, police said.

100.title: Bengaluru reports 1,154 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 7.3%
100.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,154 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 7.31% on Sunday, data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath said. As per the data, no new deaths were recorded due to the infection in the city on Sunday. Bengaluru's active case count stands at 8,595, data showed.

101.title: The more I bowled spin, the more I looked at Muralidaran: Narine
101.article_body: KKR spinner Sunil Narine revealed that he used to look up to Sri Lankan spinner Muthiah Muralidaran when the former was starting out his career as a spin bowler. "The more I bowled spin, the more I looked to Muralidaran...he had the ball going both ways. But in the beginning, it was tough [in West Indies]," Narine said.

102.title: 2nd seed Sinner beats top seed Alcaraz to win 1st title of 2022 in Croatia
102.article_body: Second-seeded Jannik Sinner beat top-seeded Carlos Alcaraz 6-7(5-7), 6-1, 6-1 to win Plava Laguna Croatia Open Umag on Sunday. It was the 20-year-old's first title of the season. "I'm obviously very happy. I have (had) a tough year until now," said Sinner. The win was the Italian's second against Alcaraz in four weeks. Overall, it was Sinner's sixth title.

103.title: Google Maps to share speed limit info with users in B'luru, Chandigarh
103.article_body: Google Maps will now display speed limit information to its users in Bengaluru and Chandigarh as part of a partnership between Google and the traffic police departments of Bengaluru and Chandigarh. Google will reportedly extend the pilot project to Kolkata and Hyderabad in the coming months. The project has already reduced 20% wait time for commuters, Bengaluru traffic police said.

104.title: Judoka Shushila Devi assures India of another CWG medal, to fight for gold tonight
104.article_body: Judoka Shushila Devi has assured India of another medal at the ongoing Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. She defeated Mauritian judoka Priscilla Morand by IPPON in the semi-final of the women's 48-kg category to reach the final. She will face Michaela Whitebooi of South Africa in the gold medal match after 9.30 pm (IST) tonight.

105.title: Tesla CEO Musk says engagement on Twitter has dropped recently
105.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said interaction with almost all Twitter accounts "seem to be much lower in recent weeks and days". Musk asked in a tweet if users think his analysis is "accurate". Reacting to Musk's tweet, a user wrote, "Nah, Elon. We're just actively ignoring you." Another user wrote, "It's because markets have been down. It'll come back."

106.title: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction ends, total bids cross ₹1.5 lakh crore
106.article_body: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction has concluded, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Monday. The total bid amount for the sale of airwaves was over ₹1.5 lakh crore at the end of the auction. Out of the 72 GHz of the spectrum that was put up for auction, around 51 GHz has been sold, Vaishnaw said.

107.title: Death toll in fire at Madhya Pradesh hospital rises to 9
107.article_body: At least nine people died after a massive fire broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Monday, Superintendent of Police (SP) Siddharth Bahuguna said. Two injured persons have been shifted to a nearby hospital for treatment. The SP said prima facie, it appears that a short circuit caused the blaze. The fire has been doused.

108.title: He would cry for meat, but we couldn't afford it: Mother of CWG gold medallist Achinta
108.article_body: After Indian weightlifter Achinta Sheuli bagged gold medal for India at CWG 2022, his mother Purnima said, "If one day he had rice on his plate, then he would not have any vegetables with it." She added, "Some days it would be eggs, while meat was something my son would cry for, but we could not afford it."

109.title: Pune Police rolls back guidelines for Ganesh Chaturthi festival
109.article_body: The Pune Police has rolled back its guidelines for the upcoming 10-day Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations, three days after issuing them. "Considering the demands raised by Ganpati mandals, we will soon issue fresh guidelines for this year's Ganpati festival," said Pune Police Joint Commissioner Sandeep Karnik. Earlier, only two box 'kamans' were permitted per Ganpati mandal in the city.

110.title: Amit Panghal enters quarterfinals in flyweight category at CWG 2022
110.article_body: Indian boxer Amit Panghal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri to enter the quarterfinals in the men's 48kg-51kg (flyweight) category at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 on Monday. Panghal won the round of 16 in a unanimous decision (5-0). The 26-year-old will next face Scottish boxer Lennon Mulligan in the quarterfinals.

111.title: Sanjay Raut tampered with evidence: ED in its 8-day custody plea
111.article_body: Seeking eight-day custody for Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, the ED in its plea said that Raut was tampering with evidence and influenced several crucial witnesses in the money laundering case. ED was granted custody of Raut till August 4, who was arrested on Sunday night in a money laundering case related to the Patra Chawl land scam case.

112.title: Andhra ex-CM NTR's daughter Uma found dead at her Hyderabad home
112.article_body: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) founder and former CM of Andhra Pradesh NT Rama Rao's (NTR's) daughter Uma Maheshwari was found dead at her residence in Hyderabad on Monday. Uma was the youngest among actor-turned-politician NTR's 12 children. Her body has been shifted to a local hospital for postmortem, reports said.

113.title: Delhi BJP leaders sit on dharna outside Kejriwal's home
113.article_body: Delhi BJP leaders sat on a dharna outside CM Arvind Kejriwal's home demanding that Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and minister Satyendar Jain be removed over charges of alleged corruption. Jain is currently in judicial custody in a case of alleged money laundering registered by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). Kejriwal was in Gujarat to address a public rally in Rajkot.

114.title: MP CM announces ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh for families of 4 killed in hospital fire
114.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday announced ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each for the families of four people who died after a massive fire broke out at a private hospital in Jabalpur. At least three other people were seriously injured in the fire. The fire began at the entrance of the hospital located near Shiv Nagar Damoh Naka.

115.title: Uddhav backs Sanjay Raut, calls him a true ‘Shiv Sainik’
115.article_body: After Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut’s arrest, former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray criticised BJP and claimed that the saffron party is trying to muzzle voices of the dissent. "Using CBI, ED and other agencies to repress dissent is not democracy,” said Uddhav. He further added that he is proud of Raut and called him a true ‘Shiv Sainik’.

116.title: China warns its military 'won't sit idly' if Pelosi visits Taiwan
116.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry, during a regular briefing, has said that its military "won't sit idly" if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan. A spokesperson of the ministry said that due to Pelosi's status as "No 3 official of US government", a visit to Taiwan would "lead to egregious political impact". This comes as Pelosi began an Asian tour.

117.title: Boeing to develop research facility in Japan to develop sustainable fuel
117.article_body: Boeing will establish a research and development centre in Japan with an aim to further develop sustainable aviation fuel (SAF). In a news release, US aircraft manufacturer said that the facility will focus on robotics, digitalisation and automation. Sustainable aviation fuel uses feedstock like animal fat and cooking oil which is more expensive than conventional jet fuel.

118.title: 20 quarantined in Kerala after youth dies of monkeypox
118.article_body: Following the death of a person due to monkeypox in Kerala, 20 people have been put under quarantine in Thrissur. “The situation is under control, there's no panic here. The deceased had direct contact with 10 people including the family members,” officials said. Meanwhile, the Centre formed a task force on monkeypox to closely monitor the situation in the country.

119.title: 126 Venezuelan migrants including 9 women deported from Mexico
119.article_body: Mexico has deported 126 Venezuelan migrants, including nine women, who were not able to prove their legal entry, the country's National Migration Institute said in a statement. The migrants boarded a flight early Saturday, it added. According to the UN, over six million Venezuelans have fled from their home country to escape violence as well as lack of essential services.

120.title: Holiday for educational institutions in parts of Kerala amid rains
120.article_body: A holiday has been declared for educational institutions in parts of Kerala on Monday amid heavy rainfall. District Collectors of Pathanamthitta and Kollam declared August 1 as a holiday for educational institutions in certain taluks in their respective districts. In Ernakulam, all departments have been directed to be prepared and fishermen have been instructed not to venture into the sea.

121.title: Shooting while pregnant was quite a task: Alia on 'Heart of Stone'
121.article_body: Speaking about her upcoming Hollywood film 'Heart of Stone', actress Alia Bhatt said that she had quite a task at hand since she was pregnant during the shoot. She added that there were many layers for her to deal with due to her pregnancy. "But they made it so seamless and so easy and so comfortable for me," Alia said.

122.title: Gambhir asked me to open, opposition didn't take me seriously: Sunil Narine
122.article_body: Talking about his batting, West Indies spinner Sunil Narine said he was first tried out as an opener in BBL, and then Gautam Gambhir asked him to open for KKR in IPL 2017. "Gambhir wanted me to get the team off to a fast start...opposition didn't take me that seriously...[but] I went from strength to strength," added Narine.

123.title: Dalit woman sexually harassed, forced to undress at gunpoint in UP; 7 arrested
123.article_body: A 30-year-old Dalit woman was allegedly sexually harassed and forced to remove her clothes at gunpoint in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar. The miscreants also recorded the act on a mobile phone camera, police said. The matter came to the fore after the incident's video was circulated on social media. Police arrested seven persons in connection with the incident on Sunday.

124.title: National Awards jury members are just Bollywood fans: Adoor Gopalakrishnan
124.article_body: Filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan has stated that now the National Awards jury comprises anonymous Bollywood fans "playing...jokes". He further said that earlier the jury consisted of well-known directors, theatre artists and critics. "[Now] some random person becomes the chairman of the jury that gives awards to some people...everyone knows the exact reason (why they got the awards)," he added.

125.title: 1st ship carrying Ukrainian grain since war began leaves Odesa
125.article_body: A ship carrying Ukrainian grain left the port of Odesa on Monday, the first departure since the Russian invasion blocked shipping. This comes after Russia and Ukraine signed separate agreements with Turkey and the UN to resume Ukrainian grain export. "It's important for us to be one of the guarantors of food security," Ukrainian Infrastructure Minister Oleksandr Kubrakov said.

126.title: 169 dengue cases so far this year in Delhi, highest since 2017
126.article_body: Nearly 170 dengue cases have been reported in Delhi this year till July 30, the highest for the period since 2017, according to a civic body report released on Monday. In 2015, Delhi witnessed a massive outbreak of dengue, with the number of cases crossing 10,600 in October alone. It was Delhi's worst dengue outbreak since 1996.

127.title: It was our worst performance: Pooran on WI's 1st T20I loss vs India
127.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran called his side's first T20I loss against India as the worst performance. "We knew something like this was going to happen," he added. Chasing 191, West Indies managed to score 122/8 in 20 overs. With 20 runs off 15 balls, Shamarh Brooks was the top-scorer for West Indies. India beat West Indies by 68 runs.

128.title: Centre taking steps to make India global drone hub by 2030: VK Singh to RS
128.article_body: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh told the Rajya Sabha on Monday that the Centre has undertaken various steps to make India a global drone hub by 2030. Replying to a query, Singh said, "Drone Airspace Map was published...last year, opening up nearly 90% of Indian airspace as a green zone for drones flying up to 400 feet."

129.title: DeHaat fires employees less than a year after raising $115 million
129.article_body: DeHaat has laid off 500 employees less than a year after securing $115 million in the largest funding round for an Indian agritech startup, Moneycontrol reported. Responding to the report, DeHaat CEO Shashank Kumar said that the number of employees affected is not in triple digits. "It was a corrective measure around performances and due to culture misfit," Kumar added.

130.title: Massive fire breaks out at MP hospital, 4 killed & 3 seriously injured
130.article_body: At least four people have died in a massive fire that broke out at a private hospital in MP's Jabalpur on Monday. An official said that at least three other people were seriously injured in the fire and that operations to save those trapped in the fire were underway. A short circuit could be the fire's cause, the official said.

131.title: Woman narrates atmosphere of football stadium to visually impaired son in Brazil
131.article_body: A video showing a woman describing the atmosphere of a football stadium before a match to her visually impaired son in Brazil has gone viral. "Son, there are flags over there...lots of Avaí fans, back here there are Flamengo fans," the woman is heard saying in the video. "We are behind the goal. Do you understand, my love?" she added.

132.title: 25-yr-old daughter of Congress leader Feroz Khan dies after car hits divider in T'gana
132.article_body: Congress leader Feroz Khan's 25-year-old daughter Tanya Kakde died in a road accident in Telangana's Shamshabad. Tanya was travelling with her friends to Hyderabad when her car hit a road divider. "She was immediately shifted to Osmania Hospital, where the doctors declared her brought dead," police said. A case has been registered.

133.title: 15-year-old girl beheads her 9-year-old relative with a sword in Rajasthan
133.article_body: A 15-year-old girl beheaded her nine-year-old niece with a sword in Rajasthan's Dungarpur district, with her family saying that she wasn't "behaving normally" for two days. As per police, the attack happened on Monday morning when the Class 10 girl and her family were performing puja at their home. The body of the victim has been sent for post-mortem.

134.title: Varun wraps Nitesh's 'Bawaal' in Poland, film to release in April 2023
134.article_body: Varun Dhawan has finished filming for his upcoming movie 'Bawaal' in Poland, the actor announced on Monday. Taking to Instagram, he shared a video announcing the wrap and shared that the film, being directed by Nitesh Tiwari, will release in theatres on April 7, 2023. In addition to Varun, 'Bawaal' will also feature Janhvi Kapoor.

135.title: Angad Bedi to star opposite Mrunal Thakur in 'Lust Stories 2': Report
135.article_body: Actor Angad Bedi will reportedly star opposite Mrunal Thakur in director R Balki's segment of the anthology film, 'Lust Stories 2'. The upcoming project will mark Angad and Balki's second collaboration after 'Ghoomer', an upcoming film starring Abhishek Bachchan, Shabana Azmi and Saiyami Kher. Angad will reportedly start working on Balki's segment from August 7 in Mumbai.

136.title: 7-yr-old critically injured as leopard tries to drag him into forest in UP
136.article_body: A seven-year-old boy was critically injured after a leopard attacked and tried to drag him into the forest in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha district. The boy was saved after villagers heard him scream and rushed to save him. Hearing the commotion, the leopard left the boy and escaped into the forest. The boy suffered deep wounds on his neck and head.

137.title: Govt engineer arrested to taking bribe of ₹50,000 in Rajasthan
137.article_body: A junior engineer working under the Rajasthan government was arrested for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹50,000 in the state's Chittorgarh district. The accused, Phoolchand Swami, was caught red-handed by an Anti-Corruption Bureau team, an official said. Swami had demanded the money from a contractor to clear the latter's outstanding bills amounting to ₹48 lakh.

138.title: Brokerage firm's director, owners arrested in Mumbai for cheating investors
138.article_body: A brokerage firm's director and its owners have been arrested by the Mumbai Police after it was found that the firm had allegedly cheated its investors to the tune of ₹1.54 crore. Three accused, Sunil, Dhiren and Anurag, have been arrested while a fourth accused, Jairaj, is absconding, police said. Notably, the firm cheated people while managing their trading accounts.

139.title: Indian weightlifter Ajay Singh lifts 319 kg at CWG, misses medal by 1 kg
139.article_body: Indian weightlifter Ajay Singh on Monday finished fourth in the men's 81-kg category at CWG 2022. The 25-year-old lifted a total of 319 kg, with 143 kg in snatch and 176 kg in the clean jerk. He attempted a 180-kg lift in his last attempt in clean and jerk but failed to lift and missed a medal by 1 kg.

140.title: Debris from SpaceX rocket launched in 2020 falls on sheep farm in Aus; pics released
140.article_body: Debris from a SpaceX rocket crashed onto a sheep farm in Australia on July 9. An astrophysicist said the debris belonged to the SpaceX Crew-1 Trunk capsule, launched in 2020. When a rocket is launched, pieces of the spacecraft often separate from the primary payload and either burn up due to friction with Earth's atmosphere or land in oceans instead.

141.title: Atul, Aditya said newcomer shouldn't do 'Laal..': Aamir on Junaid's test video
141.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that a test video with his son Junaid was shot for 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and that he was blown away by it. He said that people said he should take Junaid in the film. However, Khan said that scriptwriter Atul and filmmaker Aditya Chopra said a newcomer shouldn't do the film.

142.title: Didn’t have distributors for 'My Brother...'; Karan, Aditya helped me: Onir
142.article_body: Filmmaker Onir, in his memoir 'I Am Onir & I Am Gay', revealed he struggled to distribute his film 'My Brother...Nikhil'. He added producer-actor Sanjay Suri asked Karan Johar to watch the film. Onir said Karan loved the film, however, he didn't have the infrastructure to release the film. He stated Karan called Aditya Chopra, who agreed to distribute it.

143.title: There's scope that India will win more medals at CWG 2022: Anurag Thakur
143.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur said there's scope that India will win more medals in ongoing Commonwealth Games 2022. "I'd like to congratulate Indian weightlifters and all other athletes of Commonwealth Games...our hopes have been ascended and we'll be winning more accolades in the coming time," he added. India have won three gold, two silver and one bronze medals so far.

144.title: UP school makes students recite Kalma for 'equality'; probe ordered
144.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police and administration reached Kanpur's Florets International School on Monday after a video allegedly showing Hindu students being made to recite 'Kalma', an Islamic oath of allegiance, surfaced online. "We have prayers for all four religions. We want to teach students that all religions are equal," the school's principal clarified. An inquiry has been ordered into the matter.

145.title: Seth Rogen told me to watch 'RRR', I highly recommend it: Actor's mom
145.article_body: Sandy Rogen, mother of filmmaker-actor Seth Rogen, wrote on Twitter, "Seth told us to watch this movie on Netflix called 'RRR'. Well, I highly recommend it." Several Hollywood celebrities, including 'Doctor Strange' writer Jon Spaihts and filmmaker Joe Russo, have praised the film. 'RRR' finished runner-up in the Best Picture category at the Hollywood Critics Association Midseason Awards.

146.title: We're focused on our target: Captain Savita on match vs England at CWG
146.article_body: Ahead of their third Pool A game against England on Tuesday in the ongoing CWG 2022, Indian women's hockey team captain Savita Punia has said though the English side will have the home advantage, they are focused on their target. "It'll be all about getting the basics right...It's a crucial game and we're focused on our target," she added.

147.title: Attempt to divert attention from SSC scam: Malviya on WB to get 7 new districts
147.article_body: Soon after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that the state Cabinet has approved a proposal to carve out seven new districts, BJP’s Amit Malviya said that it is an attempt to divert attention from the SSC scam. "She must explain [from] where a debt-trapped West Bengal government gets money to run new districts?" he asked.

148.title: Poor getting 2-time free meals in India when other countries facing crisis: BJP MP
148.article_body: Addressing Lok Sabha, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey said that we should be thankful to PM Narendra Modi as poor in India are getting two-time meals free of cost. "If we see Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Bhutan, and Singapore, everywhere inflation is rising...Amid such a situation if poor are getting two-time meals free of cost then shouldn't we thank PM," he said.

149.title: LeBron James invests in Germany's bike maker Canyon Bicycles
149.article_body: Four-time NBA champion LeBron James has invested in Germany-based Canyon Bicycles through his family office LRMR Ventures. Canyon Bicycles, which manufactures a range of motorcycles and mountain bikes, said it has raised $30.5 million in funding from LRMR Ventures and US private equity firm SC Holdings. "LRMR and the SC team immediately understood our mission," Canyon's Founder Roman Arnold said.

150.title: History-sheeter killed in moving car in Hyd over property dispute
150.article_body: A man involved in at least 10 criminal cases was shot dead in Hyderabad in a moving car in what is suspected to be the fallout of a property dispute, police said. The deceased was travelling in a car with the accused on the pretext of a meeting. The discussion led to heated arguments, following which the deceased was shot.

151.title: 300 firefighters battle wildfire in France's Gard; 4 injured
151.article_body: Four firefighters were injured, two of whom were treated for burn injuries, while battling a wildfire in Aubais in France's Gard on Sunday, French Interior Minister said. About 300 firefighters were tackling the blaze, which burned 250 hectares of pine forest, authorities added. The wildfire was "very violent" due to strong winds and dry weather, a fire service spokesperson said.

152.title: SP names tribal candidate for UP council bypolls
152.article_body: Samajwadi Party has fielded tribal candidate Kirti Kol for the August 11 bypolls to the UP Legislative Council. She is the daughter of former MP Bhailal Kol. The two seats for which by-elections will be conducted, became vacant after the death of SP's Ahmad Hassan and resignation of BJP's Thakur Jaiveer Singh.

153.title: Eknath Shinde govt in Maha will collapse for sure: Aaditya Thackeray
153.article_body: Maharashtra never tolerates treachery and the Eknath Shinde-led government will collapse for sure, Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said on Monday. Aaditya added that the focus of the Shinde government is on "dirty politics" and not the welfare of the people of Maharashtra. The state witnessed incessant rains and floods, but the government is not bothered, he alleged.

154.title: HC reserves order on ex-Haryana CM's plea for suspension of sentence
154.article_body: Delhi High Court has reserved order on ex-Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala's plea seeking suspension of the four-year sentence imposed on him in a disproportionate assets case. "He's 88 and the appeal cannot be decided in one go," his advocate said. In May, a trial court awarded him a four-year jail term for acquiring disproportionate assets from 1993 to 2006.

155.title: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut sent to ED custody till August 4
155.article_body: A special court on Monday granted the custody of Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) till August 4 in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case. Earlier, the ED had sought an 8-day custody of Raut. ED's lawyer claimed that Raut was summoned four times but he appeared before the agency only once.

156.title: Nushrratt to start shooting for 'Chhorii 2' in November: Report
156.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha will reportedly start shooting for the sequel to 'Chhorii' in November this year. The story of 'Chhorii 2' will continue from part one and take on a new dimension, Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. 'Chhorii', a horror film directed by Vishal Furia, was a remake of a Marathi film titled 'Lapachhapi'.

157.title: 'Fast X' director Leterrier is dope, we're lucky to have him: Michelle
157.article_body: Actress Michelle Rodriguez, speaking about the 'Fast X' director Louis Leterrier, has said, "He's so dope, man...We're...lucky to have him." She added Leterrier came with an "energy of love". "We haven't had that in 'Fast and Furious' for a...long time where we get somebody excited who's a real fan," she added. Leterrier replaced Justin Lin as the film's director.

158.title: Probing head of country's largest chip investment fund: China's watchdog
158.article_body: China's corruption watchdog said it was probing Ding Wenwu, the head of China Integrated Circuit Industry Investment Fund, China's largest state-backed chip investment fund. Wenwu is "suspected of serious violation of the law" and is "currently undergoing disciplinary review", the watchdog said. The Fund was launched in 2014 and raised about $20.54 billion for its first fund.

159.title: BJP MPs stage protest against Bengal CM over SSC scam
159.article_body: West Bengal BJP MPs staged a protest outside the Parliament against Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee over the alleged involvement of sacked TMC minister Partha Chatterjee in the SSC scam. They were seen holding placards and raising slogans demanding arrests of those involved in the scam. Partha and his close associate Arpita Mukherjee are currently in the Enforcement Directorate's custody.

160.title: 22-year-old man stabbed to death in northeast Delhi's Khajuri Khas
160.article_body: A man was stabbed to death allegedly by a group of men in northeast Delhi's Khajuri Khas. The deceased, Anawarul Haq (22), hailed from Bihar and worked in a Biharipur-based factory which made school bags, police said. The CCTV footage showed some men, who are currently absconding, attacking the victim with knives and fleeing the spot, police added.

161.title: Fake call centre cheating US residents busted in Delhi, 1 arrested
161.article_body: The Delhi Police crime branch has busted a fake call centre, which allegedly cheated American residents by making them believe their computers were affected by a virus or hacked and arrested one person. The accused confessed that the call centre asked for $50-500 to fix the problem with the victims' computers. Incriminating evidence was found at the centre, police said.

162.title: Mani Ratnam completed Ponniyin Selvan 1 & 2 in 120 days: Karthi
162.article_body: Actor Karthi revealed filmmaker Mani Ratnam completed 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' and 'Ponniyin Selvan 2' in 120 days. "It's not easy to make two films in 120 days. We'd put on our makeup at 2-2.30 am. There'd be 30 people waiting ready to put makeup for us," he added. Karthi said they used to take the first shot at 6:30 am.

163.title: WhatsApp testing feature to allow group admins to delete messages: Report
163.article_body: Meta-owned WhatsApp is testing a new feature that allows group admins to delete messages for every member in the group chat, according to a report by WABetaInfo. This feature comes as a part of the beta release of the app on Google Play Store with version number 2.22.17.12. WhatsApp was reportedly testing waveforms for voice notes recently.

164.title: People of Gujarat will get spurious liquor if they vote for BJP: Kejriwal
164.article_body: AAP national convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that spurious liquor is being sold openly in Gujarat. "At present, people of Gujarat have two options, either they'll get spurious liquor if they vote for them (BJP) or they'll get employment if they vote for us," he added. "Electricity, school, jobs will be the issues now," Kejriwal stated.

165.title: Suspension of 4 Congress MPs withdrawn in Lok Sabha
165.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla revoked the suspension of Congress MPs, Manickam Tagore, Ramya Haridas, Jothimani and TN Prathapan, on Monday. The four party MPs were suspended on July 25 for the entire session by the speaker for carrying placards inside the House as a mark of protest. Congress leader Shashi Tharoor had earlier demanded the suspension to be revoked.

166.title: ₹3 cr illegal transaction done using a teacher's PAN number; FIR filed in Mumbai
166.article_body: A case of cheating was registered in Mumbai's Shivaji Nagar Police Station against an unidentified person for allegedly using the PAN number of a teacher for operating a GSTIN account and conducting transactions worth over ₹3 crore, police said. The matter came to light when the victim, Anil Jare, approached a CA to file his income tax return recently.

167.title: India create history, confirm their 1st ever medal in lawn bowls at CWG
167.article_body: India on Monday created history by confirming their first-ever medal in lawn bowls at CWG. India reached the gold medal match of the women's fours lawn bowls event at CWG 2022. India defeated New Zealand 16-13 in semi-final. India were represented by Lovely Choubey, Pinki, Nayanmoni Saikia and Rupa Rani Tirkey in the semi-final. The final will take place tomorrow.

168.title: He knows exactly what is required: Bhuvneshwar on Arshdeep Singh
168.article_body: Praising Arshdeep Singh, India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said his teammate's best thing is that he knows exactly what is required. "What kind of field setting is needed, how to bowl to each batsman- very few newcomers display that kind of maturity," he added. Arshdeep claimed 2/18 on his T20I debut against England and 2/24 in Friday's win against West Indies.

169.title: Woman who robbed husband 3 days after wedding arrested in MP
169.article_body: Police have arrested a woman along with her two accomplices who robbed her husband of ₹2 lakh just three days after their wedding. The incident occurred in May in Madhya Pradesh's Pithampur. Police had formed a special team to catch the three accused. The money has been recovered and the accused are being questioned.

170.title: 3 dead as car skids off road, falls into stream in Kerala amid rain
170.article_body: Three members of a family died when their car skidded off the road and fell into a nearby stream swollen with rainwater while trying to overtake a bus in Kerala's Pathanamthitta district. The passengers drowned in the stream by the time locals could rescue them, police said. An orange alert has been issued in seven districts of the state.

171.title: Nobody knew he took part, WB minister seems ignorant: Brother of CWG winner Sheuli
171.article_body: The brother of Commonwealth Games 2022 gold-winning weightlifter Achinta Sheuli said that nobody knew the 20-year-old from West Bengal participated in the Birmingham games. "Even the state's Sports Minister seems ignorant," said Alok, adding, "We need government support." Achinta, who created a Games record of 313 kg, credited his brother for the win.

172.title: Ajay Devgn has a crazy gut instinct as an artiste: 'Bholaa' writer Aamil
172.article_body: Speaking about the scripting process of 'Bholaa' with actor Ajay Devgn, co-writer Aamil Keeyan Khan has said, "Ajay has a crazy gut instinct as an artiste." Aamil added, "He knows exactly what to tweak, add and subtract to elevate a scene." The 'Runway 34' writer further said that Ajay is the happiest when he is wearing the director's hat.

173.title: Policeman beaten up for stopping tractor with illegally mined sand in Rajasthan
173.article_body: A police constable who stopped a tractor trolley with illegally mined sand was beaten up with sticks and iron rods by the driver's associates in Rajasthan's Kota on Sunday, police said. Constable Ram Chandra received multiple injuries and was shifted to a government hospital in Jhalawar. After thrashing the constable, the accused ran away with the tractor.

174.title: In previous years, England would've played more shots earlier: Morgan
174.article_body: Ex-England captain Eoin Morgan said the Jos-Buttler-led side, who lost the South Africa T20Is at home, lacked "aggressive batting" in the final two games of the three-match series. "In previous years, England would've played a lot more shots earlier as opposed to giving it more thought, more calculation," stated Morgan. England also lost the white-ball series to India in July.

175.title: ED being misused, extraordinary selective targeting of Oppn: Tharoor
175.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Monday said that the government institutions are not there to serve political purposes, the Times Now reported. "The ED is being misused…You have got an extraordinary selective targeting of Opposition people and I find this unacceptable because we are a country where democracy is a value in itself and it should be preserved," he added.

176.title: Accident causes traffic congestion at NH-48, Gurugram Police share details
176.article_body: Gurugram Traffic Police on Monday took to Twitter to inform commuters about traffic congestion, caused by an accident, on National Highway 48 (NH-48). "Traffic congestion has been reported on NH-48 near Rajiv chowk towards Delhi due to vehicle accident.
