Our traffic officials present on the spot to facilitate the traffic.@gurgaonpolice," read the tweet by Gurugram Traffic Police.

177.title: Will start shooting for 'Singham 3' in April 2023: Director Rohit Shetty
177.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty in an interview said that he'll start shooting for 'Singham 3' with actor Ajay Devgn in April 2023. "We have already started working on Singham 3...It is going to be the biggest cop universe ever that we have made till date," he added. Rohit had earlier said that 'Singham 3' will be bigger than Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Sooryavanshi'.

178.title: Video claiming a Bengaluru pothole is 10 years old goes viral
178.article_body: A video claiming that a pothole near Bengaluru's Kanakapura main road is 10 years old has gone viral on social media. The video was shared by a Twitter handle by the name of 'I CHANGE Hemmigepura'. A user replied to the tweet saying, "Proposing a birthday party for the pothole." Another user wrote, "Should declare the place as heritage monument."

179.title: India's 1st monkeypox death confirmed, victim was 22-year-old Kerala man who visited UAE
179.article_body: Kerala health department has confirmed that the 22-year-old man who died on Saturday had succumbed to monkeypox. The confirmation came from the National Institute of Virology in Pune, making it India's first confirmed monkeypox death. Earlier, Kerala Health Minister Veena George said that the man had tested positive for monkeypox in the UAE before he reached Kerala on July 22.

180.title: Wanted to jump in a hole: Meg Lanning on missing hat-trick catch at CWG
180.article_body: Australia Women captain Meg Lanning dropped Barbados' Keila Elliott's catch off Australia spinner Alana King's hat-trick delivery during their match at the CWG 2022. On being asked about it, Lanning said, "I'll have nightmares, I wanted to dig a hole and jump in it as quick as I could." Australia defeated Barbados by nine wickets in the game.

181.title: West Bengal to get 7 new districts, total number to increase to 30
181.article_body: The West Bengal Cabinet has approved a proposal to carve out seven new districts, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said on Monday. The new districts will be Berhampore, Kandi, Sunderbans, Bashirhat, Ichamati, Ranaghat and Bishnupur. A senior state government official said that the decision was taken to ensure smooth administrative operations. At present, the state has a total of 23 districts.

182.title: Uddhav visits arrested MP Sanjay Raut's house to meet his family
182.article_body: Shiv Sena chief and former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray reached arrested MP Sanjay Raut's residence on Monday to meet the former's family. Raut, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case on Monday early morning, was slated to be produced before a special PMLA court in Mumbai later in the day.

183.title: I feel more comfortable doing massy entertainers: Varun Dhawan
183.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has said that he feels "more comfortable" doing mass entertainers. "Every time I walk into a set to play a character which is very different from what I have played before, it gives me jitters," he added. Varun stated, "Even if you're doing a massy entertainer, you need to figure out newer ways of entertaining the audience."

184.title: New Bengaluru-Mysuru highway to be ready for use in Oct: Centre
184.article_body: The first phase of renovation of the Bengaluru-Mysuru national highway, which covers a 61 km-stretch between Mysuru and Nidaghatta, will be completed in September, Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said. Meanwhile, the 56.2 km--long Nidaghatta-Bengaluru stretch is likely to be opened by October 20. The highway's six main carriageways will be ready for public use by October-end, he added.

185.title: Pune woman looks for SBI number online, finds fake contact; loses ₹2,22,000
185.article_body: A Pune woman was cheated of ₹2,22,000 after she searched for the contact of State Bank of India (SBI) and found a fake one. She browsed the internet and called an SBI customer care number. The fraudster asked her to download two mobile applications on her phone and then hacked her phone and transferred ₹2,22,000 from her account.

186.title: Heroin worth ₹8 crore seized in Assam, 2 arrested for drug peddling
186.article_body: Assam Police has arrested two persons on the charge of drug peddling after seizing heroin with an international value of ₹8 crore on Sunday, officials said. A joint team of the police and CRPF intercepted a vehicle following a tip-off and recovered around 75 boxes containing 966 grams of heroin. The accused were transporting the heroin from Dimapur to Guwahati.

187.title: Actress Pranitha Subhash reveals daughter's face, names her Arna
187.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash took to Instagram on Monday to share a post revealing the face of her daughter for the first time. "Introducing Arna," she wrote alongside the picture. Reacting to her post, a fan wrote, "Super cute. God bless little angel," while another commented, "Cuteness overloaded." Pranitha and her husband Nithin Raju welcomed Arna in June.

188.title: Rajasthan man beaten up by relatives, hands tied on suspicion of affair with widow
188.article_body: A 30-year-old man was allegedly beaten up by his relatives in Rajasthan’s Jhalawar on Saturday on suspicion of having an affair with a widow in the family, police said. The man was purportedly made to walk with his hands tied, the police added. Station House Officer (SHO), Guman Singh, said that the accused "wanted to teach him a lesson".

189.title: 4th Nigerian national arrested in 10 days in Pune for drug trafficking
189.article_body: Another Nigerian national, Okeke Infechukwu John (29), was arrested by the Pune Police for allegedly carrying out drug trafficking. John is the fourth Nigerian citizen to be arrested in the last 10 days in Pune for drug-related charges. Around 18 grams of cocaine worth over Rs 2.7 lakh and two bikes were seized from John, police said.

190.title: Dubai-bound man held with foreign currency worth ₹60 lakh at Delhi airport
190.article_body: A man has been arrested from Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport with foreign currency worth ₹60 lakh including 2,62,500 Saudi Riyal and 5,000 US dollars. He was travelling to Dubai. Officials stated that the currency was concealed inside the side false layer of his handbag to avoid detection. Upon questioning, the man failed to produce valid documents for the currency.

191.title: Video of 8-year-old twin sisters confusing Viswanathan Anand with a question goes viral
191.article_body: A video of eight-year-old twin sisters confusing ex-world chess champion Viswanathan Anand with a question during Chess Olympiad went viral. Sharing it, Anand wrote, "Question of the day." In the video, one of the twin sisters seemingly asked, "How to reset the pieces?" and while Anand started answering, she interrupted, saying, "No...How to distract...pieces?" Anand replied, "I've no idea."

192.title: Price hike is normal: Kartik on rumours of increasing fee by ₹40cr
192.article_body: Reacting to rumours of increasing his fee by ₹40 crore, Kartik Aaryan neither confirmed nor denied it. He said a price hike is normal if a film is able to earn a certain amount because of the combined success rate of everyone involved. "You need to find a balance...You don't want the hike to seem to be unreal," Kartik added.

193.title: BESCOM engineer caught taking bribe of ₹1.3 lakh in Bengaluru
193.article_body: An assistant engineer of Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) was caught taking a bribe of ₹1.3 lakh by Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) officials on Monday. The engineer reportedly demanded ₹3 lakh to provide electricity connection to an apartment in Marappa Garden near Benson Town. ACB officials claim that an electrical contractor from RT Nagar requested for the line approval.

194.title: Pat Cummins marries his longtime British girlfriend, shares pic
194.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Becky Boston, who is a British-born interior designer. Sharing a picture on Instagram, he wrote, "Just married." The couple got engaged in February 2020 and they were blessed with their first child last year.  Several cricketers, including David Warner, congratulated the couple.

195.title: Mahindra & Mahindra shares hit all-time high after Scorpio-N bookings soar
195.article_body: Shares of Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) hit an all-time high of ₹1,247 apiece on Monday. On Saturday, the company recorded 1,00,000 bookings for the all-new Scorpio-N within 30 minutes of the booking commencement, with over 25,000 bookings within one minute. Notably, this was the fifth consecutive session when the stock traded higher.

196.title: 26-yr-old peddler arrested in Pune; mephedrone drug worth ₹1.07 crore seized
196.article_body: Pune Police arrested a 26-year-old peddler and seized mephedrone drug worth ₹1.07 crore in the city's Vimannagar area. The accused, Ravindra Arvind Birhade, was caught in a police-laid trap and then, booked under sections 8(c), 21(c) and 29 of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, police said. Notably, the police acted on a tip-off to catch Birhade.

197.title: 10 dead due to flooding amid heavy rains in Uganda: Red Cross
197.article_body: At least 10 people have died after heavy rains caused flooding that burst river banks in eastern Uganda, the Red Cross said on Sunday. The deceased are from the neighbouring districts of Kapchorwa and Mbale. "This disaster is due to environmental degradation...How many people are going to die like this?" the country's PM Robinah Nabbanja told reporters.

198.title: NZ fully reopens borders for 1st time since COVID-19 pandemic began
198.article_body: New Zealand on Monday fully reopened its borders to visitors for the first time since coronavirus pandemic began in March 2020. It'll now allow visitors who need visas and those on student visas to return. Cruise ships and foreign recreational yachts will also be allowed to dock at the country's ports. Most visitors will still need to be fully vaccinated.

199.title: Thanks Modi ji, do we pay GST on this too: Srinivas on Bihar minister's video
199.article_body: While tweeting the video of Bihar minister Ram Surat Rai telling people that they're all alive because of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Indian Youth Congress National President Srinivas BV said, "Thank you Modi ji, do we pay GST on this too?" Rai was speaking to the crowd about the COVID-19 pandemic.

200.title: 38 students ill after worms, insects found in Telangana school's food
200.article_body: Around 38 students fell ill, four had to be hospitalised and four others were kept in observation after consuming a meal provided at a tribal welfare gurukul school in Telangana's Mahabubabad. Students have stated that they complained after finding earthworms and insects in the food but the authorities did not pay heed. The hostel houses around 953 students.

201.title: 3 of family killed after train engine hits car at railway crossing in Assam
201.article_body: A car was hit by a train engine at the Puranigudam railway crossing in Assam's Nagaon district on Sunday night, which led to the death of three members of a family. All three died on the spot and have been identified as Chandra Kalita, Nilima Devi and Sunny Kalita, police said. Notably, the train was coming from Silghat.

202.title: 22-year-old Kanwariya dies after car hits bike in UP's Etah
202.article_body: A 22-year-old Kanwariya died and two others got injured after a car hit their motorbike in Etah, Uttar Pradesh. The incident took place at 3:30 am on Monday, police said. Notably, the car occupants were en route to Soron to immerse the ashes of a relative in the Ganges river, police added. The deceased was identified as Vinay.

203.title: It's something I'll never forget: Alia on 'Heart of Stone' shoot
203.article_body: Alia Bhatt, sharing her experience of working on her Hollywood debut 'Heart of Stone', said it's something that she'll never forget because of how beautifully she was treated over there. "I'd quite a task at hand...because I was shooting for...first time an action movie...I'm also pregnant...so there were so many layers...to deal with...But they made it so easy," she added.

204.title: West Bengal's cabinet reshuffle on Aug 3, CM says there will be 4-5 new faces
204.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday announced that cabinet reshuffle in the state will take place on Wednesday (August 3) and added that there will be four-five new faces in cabinet. "We lost Ministers Subrata Mukherjee, Sadhan Pande. Partha is in jail so all their work has to be done. Not possible for me to handle alone," Mamata said.

205.title: Not appropriate to run proceedings this way: Om Birla as LS adjourned amid protest
205.article_body: The Lok Sabha was adjourned on Monday following a protest by the Opposition MPs. “I want to maintain the dignity of the House. It’s not appropriate to run the proceedings this way,” Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said as the lower house was adjourned till 12 pm today. Later, the Lok Sabha was again adjourned till 2 pm today.

206.title: Alibaba looks to maintain NY listing after addition to US delisting watchlist
206.article_body: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holdings Ltd said it would work to maintain listings on New York Stock Exchange and Hong Kong. On Friday, US Securities and Exchange Commission added Alibaba to a list of 270 other Chinese firms that might be delisted for failing to comply with American auditing standards. US regulators demand full access to audit working papers.

207.title: 6-yr-old girl writes letter to PM Modi on rising cost of pencil, maggi; pic goes viral
207.article_body: A six-year-old girl's letter to PM Narendra Modi about the rising prices of pencil, eraser, and maggi has gone viral on social media. "Modi ji, you have caused an immense price rise...Now my mother beats me for asking for a pencil. What shall I do? Other kids steal my pencil," the girl from Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj wrote in the letter.

208.title: Forced to work as sex slave in prison, says former Israeli guard; PM orders probe
208.article_body: A former guard at a maximum security prison in Israel has alleged she was repeatedly raped by a Palestinian inmate after being forced to work as a "sex slave" by her superiors. Israeli PM Yair Lapid promised an investigation, saying, "It cannot be (tolerated) that a soldier is raped by a terrorist during her service."

209.title: Man forced to tie mother's body to bike, ride 80km after MP hospital denies hearse van
209.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol was forced to tie his dead mother's body to a motorcycle and ride it back to his village 80 km away allegedly after district hospital didn't provide a hearse van. The man reportedly couldn't afford private vehicles that asked for ₹5,000. The woman's sons alleged she died due to lack of proper treatment.

210.title: Opposition's voice being stifled using govt machinery: Shiv Sena MP
210.article_body: The people of the country are watching how voice of the Opposition is being stifled using the government machinery, Shiv Sena MP Anil Desai said on Monday. His statement came after party MP Sanjay Raut was arrested by the ED on Sunday night, after hours of questioning in relation with alleged money laundering linked to redevelopment of a Mumbai chawl.

211.title: Kerala CM cautions people amid heavy rain warning
211.article_body: Kerala CM P Vijayan has warned the public to exercise caution amid forecast of heavy rainfall. Government agencies have been instructed to be on alert and people living in low-lying areas have been advised to evacuate. “As the India Meteorological Department has warned of heavy rains in the state for next five days, people should be very vigilant,” said Vijayan.

212.title: Taliban denies 'drone attack' in Kabul, says rocket hit empty house
212.article_body: A spokesperson from the Taliban's Interior Ministry on Sunday denied reports of a drone attack in Afghanistan's Kabul and said that a rocket had hit an empty house, reported TOLO news. Earlier, Afghanistan's former National Directorate of Security (NDS) head Rahmatullah Nabil had tweeted, "As per ground sources...American drones were seen in (Kabul's) airspace...and struck different locations."

213.title: Woman who started as a sweeper, becomes AGM at SBI in Mumbai 37 years later
213.article_body: A woman, aged 20, who started working as a part-time sweeper at an SBI branch in Mumbai after her husband's demise, has risen to become the bank's Assistant General Manager 37 years later. Pratiksha Tondwalkar got married at the age of 16, before completing her Class 10 exams. She cleared her subsequent studies after joining the bank as a sweeper.

214.title: Not in favour of Pant opening, he's India’s pivotal player: Reetinder Sodhi
214.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi has said he doesn't want Rishabh Pant to open for India in T20Is as the wicketkeeper-batter is the team's pivotal player. "India need him when the game gets tight in the 15th-16th over. You can better utilise him in the middle overs," stated Sodhi. Pant opened in two T20Is in England and scored 26 and 1.

215.title: Lawyer who filed PILs against Jharkhand CM arrested in Kolkata
215.article_body: Lawyer Rajiv Kumar, who had filed PILs against Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren over corruption, was arrested by Kolkata Police on Sunday for allegedly cheating people of ₹50 lakh. Kumar was picked up from a bar under the Hare Street police station area following a warrant issued against him by Jharkhand Police. Stacks of money were reportedly found on him.

216.title: Which states have received less than normal rainfall so far?
216.article_body: India Meteorological Department data showed that till July 31, UP had a rain deficiency of 46%, Jharkhand 49%, Bihar 39% and West Bengal 26%. There has also been 16% rain deficiency over eastern and northeastern India. IMD DGM Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said there were above normal rains over central and peninsular India, but high deficiency over states in the Gangetic plains.

217.title: 325+ K'taka buses booked for Siddaramaiah's b'day, hundreds more to be booked
217.article_body: More than 325 buses of the Northwest Karnataka Road Transport Corporation have been booked for the celebration of 75th birth anniversary programme of Congress leader Siddaramaiah in Davanagere. Reports said that hundreds of more buses are expected to be booked. Reports added that preparations to invite and take 5000-6000 workers from each assembly constituency of the district.

218.title: Arjun, Tara hold housefull board for 'Ek Villain Returns' at Gaiety Cinema
218.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a picture on Sunday of holding a housefull sign outside Mumbai's Gaiety Cinema for his film 'Ek Villain Returns'. Arjun was joined by his co-stars Tara Sutaria and Disha Patani. He wrote alongside the picture, "Housefull board outside a cinema that's all we work for." The film has earned $1 million at the global box office.

219.title: Kichcha Sudeepa's 'Vikrant Rona' crosses ₹100cr worldwide after 1st weekend
219.article_body: Kichcha Sudeepa-starrer 'Vikrant Rona' is estimated to have collected over ₹110 crore worldwide within four days of its release. As per estimates from the industry, it earned approximately ₹29 crore on Sunday.  The film was released in five languages including Kannada, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Hindi. It is directed by Anup Bhandari and also features Nirup Bhandari and Neetha Ashok.

220.title: Loud music at night to end soon: Hyderabad Police Commissioner
220.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand said that authorities will soon put an end to loud music being played at night. His statement comes after loud music was played near his residence in wee hours of Sunday. The commissioner said that he called 100 and did not reveal his identity while making the complaint and was happy with police's quick response.

221.title: Pat Carroll, voice behind Disney villain Ursula in Little Mermaid, dies at 95
221.article_body: American actress and comedian Pat Carroll, voice behind Disney villain Ursula in 'The Little Mermaid', has passed away at the age of 95. Carroll died on Saturday of pneumonia at her home in Massachusetts, her daughter Kerry Karsian told The Hollywood Reporter. Carroll won an Emmy for her work on the sketch comedy series 'Caesar's Hour' in 1956.

222.title: Raut held for non-cooperation, unaccounted cash & incriminating documents: ED
222.article_body: As per Hindustan Times, the Enforcement Directorate officials said that Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut was arrested due to "non-cooperation", "unaccounted cash recovered at his residence", and recovery of "incriminating documents" from his place. ED had detained Raut after conducting a search for over nine hours at Raut's Bhandup residence on Sunday.

223.title: Sanjay Arora takes charge as Delhi Police Commissioner
223.article_body: Sanjay Arora, a senior IPS officer of Tamil Nadu cadre, took charge as the Commissioner of Delhi Police today (August 1). The 57-year-old officer was accorded the ceremonial guard of honour by the police force upon his arrival at the Delhi Police Headquarters. He will succeed Rakesh Asthana who retired on Sunday (July 31) after nearly 38 years in service.

224.title: 16-year-old student confirmed as 1st monkeypox case in Sudan
224.article_body: Sudan's Health Ministry said in a statement on Sunday that the country has recorded its first monkeypox case. The statement added that a 16-year-old student was confirmed to be infected with the disease on Thursday in West Darfur state. A senior official from the ministry said that the other 38 suspected cases of the disease have all tested negative.

225.title: Beirut grain silo damaged in 2020 blast collapses after weeks-long fire
225.article_body: A section of grain silo at Beirut port collapsed on Sunday, after weeks-long fire triggered by summer heat fermented grains. Last week, Lebanese officials had warned that a part of the silo could collapse after it started tilting. The incident reminded the capital city of the horrors of the 2020 explosion that left 215 people dead, Reuters reported.

226.title: Truly a proud moment as Achinta from WB wins CWG gold: Mamata Banerjee
226.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee took to Twitter to congratulate 20-year-old weightlifter Achinta Sheuli for winning the gold medal in the men's 73-kg category at the CWG 2022. "Truly a proud moment for all of us as young Achinta from West Bengal wins gold...Your success will serve as an inspiration to countless others in the country," tweeted CM Banerjee.

227.title: Bihar minister tells crowd 'You're alive because of PM Modi', video viral
227.article_body: In a video that has gone viral on social media, Bihar minister Ram Surat Rai, a BJP leader, can be seen telling a crowd, "If you all...are alive today...it is because of...[PM] Narendra Modi." He said so while talking about COVID-19 pandemic. "We were saved by...Modi's vaccine and his deft handling of economy," he can be seen saying in video.

228.title: Telangana government to distribute 1 crore national flags
228.article_body: The Telangana government will celebrate 'Swatantra Bharatha Vajrotsavalu' for two weeks from August 8 in wake of the nation's 75th Independence Day. It will distribute 1 crore national flags for hoisting across the state. Films on unity and patriotism will also be shown free of cost to school children in all the cinema halls.

229.title: Before Satya's release, SRK joked 'remove JD & put me in film': JD
229.article_body: Actor JD Chakravarthy recalled how he got a phone call from Shah Rukh Khan the evening before Satya's release. "He said, 'If 'Satya' is to become...disaster, what do you think we should do?' I got offended and said, 'You tell me what we should do'," JD said, adding, "Shah Rukh said, 'Replace JD...with Shah Rukh.' I understood he was joking."

230.title: People feel I don't like India: Aamir Khan on 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' Twitter trend
230.article_body: Reacting to 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' trend on Twitter, Aamir Khan said, "I feel sad that some of the people who are saying this, in their heart, they believe that I am someone who doesn't like India....but it is untrue." Calling it unfortunate that people feel that way, he urged, "Please don't boycott my film."

231.title: Why is China's real estate sector currently facing a crisis?
231.article_body: China's real estate sector is currently facing a crisis as buyers across the country have stopped paying mortgages for homes sold before completion. The boycott comes after the sector was hit by a funding crisis, leading to defaults and stalled projects. Meanwhile, S&P Global Ratings estimated that Chinese banks could face $356 billion in losses due to the ongoing crisis.

232.title: That's gonna be crazy one: Naga on if he will do a film with Samantha
232.article_body: During an interview, actor Naga Chaitanya was asked if he and his ex-wife Samantha Prabhu will ever share screen space in a film. To this, the actor replied, "That's gonna be a crazy one if it happens. But I don't know, only the universe knows. Let's see." Naga and Samantha announced their split on Instagram in October 2021.

233.title: Shreyas is ahead of Hooda in pecking order: Saba Karim on no.3 spot in T20Is
233.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has said Shreyas Iyer is ahead of Deepak Hooda in the pecking order for the number three position in India's T20I playing XI. "That being the case, he will have to be given a few more chances in the upcoming games," added Karim. Shreyas got out for a duck in the first T20I against West Indies.

234.title: 4 arrested in Bengaluru for blackmailing widows, divorcees over nude videos
234.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested four members of a gang for allegedly assaulting, blackmailing and extorting widows and divorced women over nude videos. The accused, including a woman, targeted the victims under the pretext of helping them out with financial assistance and jobs, the police said. They later kidnapped the victim and would threaten them to strip and made nude videos.

235.title: India's manufacturing PMI surges to 8-month high of 56.4 in July
235.article_body: India's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI), compiled by S&P Global, surged to an eight-month high amid growth in new orders and output. The PMI rose to 56.4 in July as compared to 53.9 in June and 54.6 in May. The July PMI data indicated an improvement in overall operating conditions for the 13th straight month.

236.title: Issue of 'Operation Keechad’ in J’khand to be raised in Parliament: Kharge
236.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday said that the Opposition will raise the issues of inflation and the Gujarat hooch tragedy in the Parliament. "'Operation Keechad' by them (BJP) in Jharkhand will also be raised today," Kharge added. His statement came after three Jharkhand MLAs were caught with huge amount of cash on Saturday. They were suspended from Congress.

237.title: Firefighters battle blaze near Lisbon amid strong winds
237.article_body: More than 400 firefighters, backed by water-bombers and 123 vehicles, battled a blaze burning near Lisbon, the capital city of Portugal. Soaring temperatures and strong winds made it more difficult to put out the fire, forcing authorities to block several roads, reports said. Portugal has been facing a heatwave, like other parts of Europe, with temperatures reaching 40 degree Celsius.

238.title: GST collection hits nearly ₹1.49 lakh crore in July, second-highest ever
238.article_body: The government on Monday said that ₹1,48,995 crore gross GST revenue was collected in July 2022, marking the second highest amount of revenue collected since the introduction of GST. The revenues for July are 28% higher than the GST revenues in the same month last year. The highest GST collection ever recorded was in April 2022 at ₹1.68 lakh crore.

239.title: Why is ED silent on Jharkhand Congress MLAs cash case?: TMC
239.article_body: The Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress questioned Enforcement Directorate's (ED) "silence" on the recovery of unaccounted cash worth lakhs from the vehicle of Congress MLAs from Jharkhand. TMC also demanded a probe into the role of West Bengal's Leader of the Opposition Suvendu Adhikari over his recent remark that "after Maharashtra, it will be Jharkhand, Rajasthan and West Bengal."

240.title: US House Speaker Pelosi begins tour of 4 Asian nations
240.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi began an Asian tour during which she is scheduled to visit Singapore, Malaysia, South Korea and Japan. "The trip will focus on mutual security, economic partnership and democratic governance in the Indo-Pacific region," an official statement said. There have been speculation but no confirmation over whether Pelosi will visit the self-ruled island nation Taiwan.

241.title: Japan calls for release of Japanese man detained in Myanmar
241.article_body: Japan has called for the release of a Japanese man who has been detained in Myanmar. According to Deputy Chief Cabinet Secretary, the detained Japanese national is in his 20s and was filming a documentary. Local media reports said that the man was participating in an anti-coup protest held in Yangon and was detained for questioning at a police station.

242.title: Father-son sentenced to 20 yrs for abduction, rape of minor girl in Raj
242.article_body: A POCSO court in Rajasthan's Kota sentenced a man and his father to 20 years for the abduction and rape of a minor girl. The convict is a cousin of the victim who was 13 at the time of the crime. Court imposed ₹30,000 fine on him and ₹20,000 on his father for rendering protection and help in the crime.

243.title: 24-yr-old man undergoes hands transplant in TN, hands flown in from Gujarat
243.article_body: A 24-year-old man from Tamil Nadu successfully underwent a bilateral hand transplant surgery involving a marathon procedure, the hospital treating him said on Sunday. The man had lost both his hands suffering burns from electrocution in 2018 and his mother was taking care of him, the hospital release said. The donor hands were flown to Chennai from Gujarat after clearances.

244.title: Haven't been home at all in last 2 years: India's 19-yr-old Jeremy after winning CWG gold
244.article_body: After bagging gold at CWG 2022, 19-year-old Indian weightlifter Jeremy Lalrinnunga, who hails from Mizoram's Aizawl, stated he hasn't been home at all in the last two years. "I'm thinking of taking leave for seven days to go home and spend time with family," he said. Jeremy lifted a total of 300 kg in men's 67-kg category to bag gold.

245.title: Video of biryani pots drifting away in Hyderabad rains goes viral; Twitter users react
245.article_body: A video showing two biryani vessels floating away in a waterlogged street in Hyderabad has gone viral on Twitter. The video was shot outside 'Adiba Hotel' in Hyderabad's Nawab Saheb Kunta. "Somebody is going to be unhappy for not getting his biryani order," wrote a Twitter user. Another user wrote, "Dum biryani ki aisi ki taisi...new hit is Tairti Biryani."

246.title: Why Gujarat youth is being pushed towards drug addiction?: Rahul
246.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP for allegedly protecting the drugs and liquor mafias in Gujarat. "How come drugs are constantly shipped to Mundra port despite it being recovered from there thrice...Whether law and order don't exist in Gujarat?" Rahul tweeted. He asked, "Why the youth of Gujarat is being pushed towards drug addiction?"

247.title: Delhi govt to allow private liquor shops to operate for one more month
247.article_body: Delhi government will be releasing permit for private liquor shops to run for one more month in  national capital. Reports quoted a source saying that government shops might take another month to start, which is why private ones are being allowed to run for extended period. Private liquor shops had to shut on July 31 following expiration of their licenses.

248.title: Favreau said 'You can't kill Iron Man, it'll devastate people': Joe Russo
248.article_body: Filmmaker Joe Russo, who was the co-director of 'Avengers: Endgame', revealed that Jon Favreau asked them not to kill Iron Man in the film. "Favreau was like, 'You can't do this. It's gonna devastate people and you don't want them...walking out of the theatre and into traffic'," Joe added. "We did it anyway," he further stated.

249.title: Pic shows french fries & sausage being sold for ₹1,000 at CWG; Twitter users criticise
249.article_body: A fan purchased frozen french fries and sausage at the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham for £9.80 (nearly ₹1,000) and took to Twitter to share a photo of it. Reacting to his photo, a Twitter user commented, "The chips look like they were cooked in a kettle." Another remarked, "Do you have to pay more to get the chips cooked."

250.title: England beat Germany in extra time to win their first-ever Women's Euro
250.article_body: England defeated eight-time champions Germany in extra time to win their first-ever Women's European Championship. England's Chloe Kelly scored in the extra time with the game levelled at 1-1 after 90 minutes. "It's the proudest moment of my life so I'm going to lap it up and take every single second in," said England captain Leah Williamson.

251.title: UN peacekeepers open fire at border post in Congo, kill 2 people
251.article_body: UN peacekeepers who were returning from leave opened fire at a border post in Democratic Republic of Congo's (DRC) Kasindi, killing at least two people and injuring 15 others, UN and Congo officials said on Sunday. The peacekeepers were military personnel of UN mission in the country. The perpetrators were arrested, the head of the UN mission in DRC said.

252.title: Son clears army training from same academy 27 years after his mother; govt shares pics
252.article_body: Defence Ministry's Public Relations Officer of Chennai shared a picture of retired Major Smita Chaturvedi posing with her son after he cleared his army training. "A rare euphoric moment for a Lady Officer: Major Smita Chaturvedi (Retd) Commissioned from Officers Training Academy, Chennai...in 1995, saw her son getting Commissioned in the same manner in the same Academy," the post read.

253.title: Divine punishment: BJP's Ram Kadam after ED arrests Sanjay Raut
253.article_body: BJP leader Ram Kadam, without naming Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut after the ED arrested him, on Monday said it is a "divine punishment". "That's why they say, it isn't good to play with fire...This is a divine punishment...These are newly changed India's laws and empowered power of democracy," Kadam tweeted. Raut was arrested by the ED on Sunday night.

254.title: Shiv Sena plans to launch protests against Raut's arrest by ED
254.article_body: Shiv Sena is planning to launch protests against Sanjay Raut's arrest by ED, Raut's brother Sunil Raut stated. Shiv Sena is firmly behind the Raut family and will stand with it till Sanjay Raut is released from custody, he added. He was arrested after hours of questioning in relation with alleged money laundering linked to redevelopment of a Mumbai chawl.

255.title: Dharmendra wraps up Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'
255.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra has wrapped his shoot on Karan Johar's directorial 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. The actor was joined by son Bobby Deol and grandson Aryaman Deol on the last day of his shoot. In the upcoming movie, Dharmendra will share screen space with Ranveer Singh, Alia Bhatt, Shabana Azmi, Jaya Bachchan and others.

256.title: We told Pak terrorism is high cost option after Pulwama: Tamil Nadu Guv
256.article_body: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi has stated that India's response to the Pulwama terror attack showed Pakistan that terrorism is a high-cost option. "What happened after Pulwama? We hit them back. 250 km inside using airpower. With precision," he said. Ravi further stated that anyone who uses a gun should be dealt with a gun with zero tolerance for violence.

257.title: Man suffering from mental illness jumps to death from Mumbai hotel
257.article_body: A 59-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after he jumped from the ninth floor of a five-star hotel in Lower Parel, Mumbai. The deceased, Sorab Khandalawala, was undergoing treatment for mental illness since 2005 at Masina hospital in Byculla, police said. Notably, Khandalawala had come to the hotel for lunch on Sunday before allegedly killing himself at 1 pm.

258.title: We don't even have soil to put on wickets in Pak: Salman Butt on foreign mentors in PJL
258.article_body: Pakistan's former skipper Salman Butt took a dig at the PCB and its chairman Ramiz Raja for bringing mentors from abroad for Pakistan Junior League (PJL). Butt said, "There are no players who can mentor youngsters in Pakistan. We don't even have soil to put on wickets in Pakistan." He added, "Bring a chairman from some other country too, no?"

259.title: Was a pre-emptive strike: Singer Madonna on directing her own biopic
259.article_body: Singer Madonna opened up about directing her biopic and called it a "pre-emptive strike" as many people were trying to make a film about her. "A lot of people were trying to make movies about me. Mostly misogynistic men. So, I put my foot in the door and said, 'No one's going to tell my story but me'," she added.

260.title: Vijay Deverakonda's female fan faints amid overcrowding at Liger event in Navi Mumbai
260.article_body: A female fan fainted as massive crowd turned up at Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday starrer Liger's promotional event at a Navi Mumbai mall. A video shared by Viral Bhayani showed staff helping the woman. The actors were forced to leave the event midway, with Dharma Productions saying, "Unfortunately, we had to leave mid-way for the safety of everyone."

261.title: Was great to share screen space with Aamir Khan in 'Laal...': Naga
261.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya opened up about his experience of working with Aamir Khan in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "The experience was simply great. I decided to do 'Laal Singh Chaddha' even before I heard the script, as I wanted to be next to Aamir," he stated. Naga said Aamir taught him so much and added he's glad he got this opportunity.

262.title: Won't bow down: Shiv Sena MP on Sanjay Raut's arrest
262.article_body: After Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in an alleged money laundering case, MP Vinayak Raut has vowed to back his party leader. "We will not bow down to ED. Raut has full support of Maharashtra," said Vinayak. Sanjay Raut was arrested by ED on Sunday night after hours of questioning in the ₹1,034 crore scam.

263.title: DTCP seals 123 shops, demolishes 12 in Gurugram's DLF Phase-3
263.article_body: The enforcement team of Department of Town & Country Planning (DTCP) demolished 12 illegal shops and sealed 123 more on 43 plots in Block U of DLF Phase-3, Gurugram. The action was taken in presence of 150 police personnel. "Many property owners had put large plyboards to hide their shop signs on residential plots...This is illegal," a senior official said.

264.title: Video of 20-year-old Achinta lifting record 170 kg to win gold at CWG goes viral
264.article_body: A video of 20-year-old Indian weightlifter Achinta Sheuli lifting a record 170 kg in clean and jerk to win gold in men's 73-kg category went viral. Achinta failed to lift 170 kg in second attempt, however, he made a successful lift in third attempt. Achinta lifted a total of 313 kg, including 143 kg in snatch, to set CWG record.

265.title: I have no home to go to: SL President after protesters burn down his house
265.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Ranil Wickremesinghe said that people have threatened to stage protests if he doesn't go home. "I am appealing to you not to do that as I have no home to go to," Wickremesinghe, whose private residence was set on fire by protesters last month, said. Protesters must either rebuild the country or rebuild the house, he added.

266.title: 'Rang De Basanti' was exciting for me for 9 minutes: Madhavan
266.article_body: Speaking about his role in 2006 film 'Rang De Basanti', actor R Madhavan stated that the film was only valid and very exciting for him for nine minutes. The actor had nine minutes of screen presence in the film. He portrayed Flight Lt Ajay Singh Rathod who is killed when his MiG-21 jet malfunctions and crashes.

267.title: Confidence has taken bit of a dent: Buttler after T20I series defeat to SA
267.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler said their confidence has taken a "bit of a dent" after they lost the three-match T20I series against South Africa 1-2. "I can be honest enough to say we haven't performed how we would've liked the whole summer," he stated. England suffered a 90-run defeat in the third T20I against South Africa on Sunday.

268.title: BMC's fire audit finds serious lapses in 441 nursing homes in Mumbai
268.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), which conducted a special drive of fire audit from July 11-25, has found 441 nursing homes across Mumbai to have not complied with the fire safety norms and registered an FIR against 10 such nursing homes. The civic body inspected 1,258 nursing homes, out of which 643 nursing homes have complied with fire safety measures.

269.title: Zomato to get multiple CEOs for its firms, will call organisation 'Eternal': CEO Goyal
269.article_body: In an internal communication to the staff, Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal said that the company will now have multiple CEOs for its entities- Zomato, Blinkit, Hyperpure and Feeding India. He added the larger organisation will be called 'Eternal', however, this will be an internal name for now. He added that all CEOs will act as peers to each other.

270.title: 105 people, including tourists, rescued after flash floods in Himachal
270.article_body: At least 105 people, including mostly tourists, were rescued after they were stranded due to flash floods in Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul and Spiti on Sunday. A parked vehicle was damaged after boulders fell on it. The tourists were rescued in a three-hour-long rescue mission around 1:30 am and all of them are safe and provided food and logistics, officials stated.

271.title: Hyd techie rescued from valley near Dhakoba fort near Pune after 11 hrs
271.article_body: A Hyderabad techie who came to Maharashtra's Murbad on Saturday for a trek near Pune, lost his way due to fog in the area. After he contacted Maharashtra Mountaineering Rescue Coordination Centre (MMRCC) for help, he was rescued after 11 hours. The rescue team had reached the area with necessary equipments and an ambulance.

272.title: Disruption in Parliament adversely impacts common man's life: RS Dy Chairman
272.article_body: Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh Narayan Singh on Sunday said that a disruption in the Parliament has an adverse impact on the life of a common man. The Parliament can abdicate its responsibility only at its own peril, he added. Furthermore, he said that continued interruption in the Parliament can give way to lack of executive accountability and judicial overreach.

273.title: Harvest under threat to be twice less this year: Ukraine Prez
273.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy tweeted on Sunday that the country's harvest is under threat this year and will be "twice less" amid war with Russia. Earlier, Ukraine and Russia had signed separate but identical agreements with Turkey and UN to resume Ukrainian grain export. He said that Ukraine's main goal is to "prevent global food crisis caused by Russian invasion".

274.title: Myanmar junta to extend state of emergency for 6 months
274.article_body: The state of emergency in Myanmar will be extended for six more months. "We must continue to strengthen the genuine and disciplined multi-party democratic system," the head of Myanmar's junta, Min Aung Hlaing reportedly said. Myanmar military staged a coup in February 2021, overthrowing the democratically elected leader Aung San Suu Kyi, triggering nation-wide protests against the military rule.

275.title: Why is he mincing words?: Owaisi on Doval's 'counter radical forces' remark
275.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval after he urged religious leaders to counter the radical forces trying to create animosity as it adversely affects the entire country. "We were expecting that NSA should tell everyone who are these 'some elements' who are spreading bigotry. Why is he mincing words? He should tell," Owaisi said.

276.title: Star Trek actress Nichelle Nichols passes away aged 89
276.article_body: Actress Nichelle Nichols, known for her portrayal of Lt Nyota Uhura in 'Star Trek: The Original Series', passed away aged 89. "Last night, my mother...succumbed to natural causes...Her light, however, like the ancient galaxies now being seen for the first time, will remain for us and future generations to enjoy, learn from and draw inspiration," her son Kyle Johnson said.

277.title: There's a village where every house worships me, that scares me: Sudeep
277.article_body: Kiccha Sudeep in an interview revealed that there's a village where every house worships him. "Every house has my picture and they worship it every morning. That scares me...When people call me there...it scares me...That's not a position I wanted ever," he added. Sudeep further said some of his fans have their entire body tattooed with his name and pictures.

278.title: Rejected B'wood films as I was insecure about my Hindi: Naga Chaitanya
278.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who will be making his Bollywood debut with 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said he rejected offers of Bollywood films because he was insecure about his Hindi. "I grew up in Chennai...shifted to Hyderabad...my Hindi has not been the best," he added. Naga stated, "Aamir Khan was...comfortable...because I'm being cast as a South Indian boy who goes up north."

279.title: Banker's home burgled of ₹50,000 cash, jewellery in Ludhiana
279.article_body: A banker's house was burgled of ₹50,000 cash and jewellery in Ludhiana while he was sleeping in the other room with his family. The victim stated that he came to know about it the next morning when he found the room ransacked and almirah open. He has reported three gold chains, eight rings, earrings and a diamond nose pin stolen.

280.title: Transmission lines trip after copper earthing stolen from Gurugram gantry
280.article_body: Two sections of high-tension transmission lines of the Bhakra-Beas Management Board, measuring around 120 km each, tripped and remained dysfunctional for four days after earthing copper wires were allegedly stolen from a gantry in Sector-36, Gurugram. This resulted in around 440 metres of wires getting damaged permanently from overheating leading to a total loss of around ₹1.6 crore to BBMB.

281.title: Who is new Delhi Police Commissioner Sanjay Arora?
281.article_body: Director General of ITBP, Sanjay Arora, was appointed as Delhi Police Commissioner on Sunday. He earlier served in Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) on deputation as commandant from 1997 to 2002 and also served as IG (special operations) BSF, IG Chhattisgarh Sector CRPF and IG Operations CRPF. Arora also served as Commissioner of Police of Coimbatore city from 2002 to 2004.

282.title: Title of Kartik, Kiara's Satyanarayan Ki Katha changed to Satyaprem Ki Katha
282.article_body: The title of Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani's film 'Satyanarayan Ki Katha' has been changed to 'Satyaprem Ki Katha'. Last year, the film's director Sameer Vidwans shared a statement saying that the title of the film would be changed to "avoid hurting sentiments". In the film, Kartik will essay the role of Satyaprem while Kiara will be seen as Katha.

283.title: India reports 16,464 new COVID-19 cases, 39 deaths in 24 hours
283.article_body: India has reported 16,464 COVID-19 cases, 16,112 recoveries and 39 deaths in the last 24 hours including 15 reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 19,673 cases and 45 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases rose to 1,43,989, while the death toll reached 5,26,396.

284.title: Who are India's gold medal contenders at CWG 2022 for today?
284.article_body: India are in contention for several gold medals on Day 4 of CWG 2022. Indian weightlifter Ajay Singh's men's 81-kg final will begin at 2 pm. Pranati Nayak's women's vault final will start at 6.40 pm. Cyclist Ronaldo Singh's men's time trial final will start at 8.02 pm. Weightlifter Harjinder Kaur's women's 71-kg event will begin at 11 pm.

285.title: Pic of 19-yr-old Indian weightlifter Jeremy's tattoos after he wins CWG gold goes viral
285.article_body: A picture of 19-year-old Indian weightlifter Jeremy Lalrinnunga's tattoos on arm went viral after he bagged gold at CWG 2022. One tattoo depicts a person lifting weights, with date November 11, 2011 written above it in Roman numerals. Jeremy had started lifting weights on the same date. The other shows a man standing straight wearing boxing gloves, depicting his father.

286.title: Punjab IMA chief seeks state Health Minister’s dismissal after VC incident
286.article_body: Punjab IMA President, Dr Paramjit Singh Mann, said Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann should remove state Health Minister Chetan Singh Jouramajra from ministerial post. This comes after Dr Raj Bahadur, who resigned as the VC of BFUHS, was asked to lie down on a dirty patient bed by Jouramajra. "If government doesn't support us...we'll move towards non-cooperation (protest)," Dr Mann added.

287.title: Macau to reopen venues after no COVID-19 cases for 9 days
287.article_body: Macau will resume public services and reopen entertainment facilities after reporting zero COVID-19 cases for nine straight days. Authorities will allow restaurants, beauty salons, fitness centres and bars to resume operations from Tuesday. People will have to wear a mask in public and show a negative COVID-19 test report to enter most venues. Macau reported around 1,800 cases since mid-June.

288.title: Dedicating this medal to my brother, coaches: Achinta after gold at CWG
288.article_body: Weightlifter Achinta Sheuli, who won gold in the men's 73-kg category at the CWG 2022, has said that he wants to dedicate his medal to his brother and his coaches. "After overcoming many struggles, I won this medal...next, I'll prepare for the Olympics," he added. With Achinta's gold, India have now won six medals in the ongoing tournament.

289.title: Salman Khan gets arms license after recent death threats
289.article_body: Mumbai Police has said that actor Salman Khan has been issued an arms license after he applied for it for self-protection. The police stated that he applied for a weapon license "in the backdrop of threat letters that he received recently". Police had earlier said that jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi allegedly issued threat letter to Salman Khan.

290.title: I did 'Freddy' as it was supposed to be released on OTT: Kartik Aaryan
290.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, speaking about his upcoming film 'Freddy', has said that he shot for the film keeping in mind that it will be released on the OTT platform. "I did that film because it was supposed to release on OTT," the actor stated. Kartik further added, "It is a nice subject that I am really excited about."

291.title: Don’t know why I'm called for music videos at 50, not someone who's 20: Milind
291.article_body: Actor Milind Soman said he doesn't know why they called him at the age of 50 for the music video of 'Shringaar' and not someone who is 20. He added the song is an objectification of the male persona. On being asked if he is uncomfortable, Milind said that he has been objectified right from the beginning of his career.

292.title: Putin signs doctrine on Navy Day, deems US as Russia's main rival
292.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed a new naval doctrine which deems the US as the country's main rival. Putin said Russia will receive Zircon cruise missile, warning that the country has the military capability to defeat its potential aggressors. During his speech on Russia's Navy Day, Putin praised Tsar Peter the Great for making the country a sea power.

293.title: India beat South Africa 3-0 in badminton mixed team event, enter semis at CWG
293.article_body: India have entered the semi-finals in the badminton mixed team event after a 3-0 win over South Africa at the CWG 2022. Ashwini Ponnappa and Sumeeth Reddy won the mixed doubles match, while Lakshya Sen won the men's singles in straight sets. Aakarshi Kashyap also won the women's singles in straight sets to seal the semi-final spot for the team.

294.title: How does the Commonwealth Games 2022 medal tally read as India win 3 gold medals?
294.article_body: India have jumped to the sixth position on the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 after bagging a total of three gold medals so far. Australia continue to be on top of the medal standings, with 22 gold medals. Australia are followed by England (11 gold medals) and New Zealand (10 gold medals). South Africa are placed fourth with four gold medals.

295.title: Ananya carried herself so well in 'Koffee...', proud of her: Chunky
295.article_body: Actor Chunky Panday, speaking about his daughter and actress Ananya Panday's appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', has said, "She carried herself so well in KWK (Koffee With Karan)." He further added that he is "very proud" of Ananya. "She should never lose that honesty in her," Chunky stated. Ananya appeared on the show with actor Vijay Deverakonda.

296.title: Cockroaches found in food, 2 cafes sealed in Pak's Parliament: Report
296.article_body: Two cafeterias in the Parliament House in Pakistan's Islamabad were sealed after lawmakers filed a complaint that cockroaches were found in the food that was being served to them, news channel Samaa TV reported. Following this, the city's administration raided the cafeterias, it said. On inspection, authorities found vermin in the eating area and unsanitary conditions in kitchen, it added.

297.title: Ukrainian millionaire and his wife killed after Russian missile hits their home
297.article_body: Ukrainian millionaire Oleksiy Vadatursky and his wife Raisa were killed after a Russian missile struck their home in the city of Mykolaiv on Sunday. Vadatursky was the Founder of Nibulon, one of the largest agricultural companies in Ukraine. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy described his death as "a great loss" and said people like him have guaranteed the world's food security.

298.title: Why do people see politics in 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign?: Union Minister
298.article_body: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said that 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign is an appeal by PM Narendra Modi and not by BJP, the Times Now reported. "If not PM...who'll give call for this? Why do some people see politics in this?" Pradhan asked. "We expect...every Indian house hoists...Tricolour to celebrate 75 years of India's independence. What's wrong with that?" he added.

299.title: Man arrested in Mumbai for cheating senior citizens at ATMs
299.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 28-year-old man, who allegedly offered help to senior citizens who struggled with withdrawing cash from ATMs, and later took money from their accounts. When the victims handed over their ATM cards to the accused, he would swap them with an inactive card. He would loiter near the ATMs outside the railway stations, the police said.

300.title: Who have won medals for India at Commonwealth Games 2022 so far?
300.article_body: Indian weightlifters Mirabai Chanu, Jeremy Lalrinnunga and Achinta Sheuli have won gold medals at Commonwealth Games 2022 in women's 49kg, men's 67kg and men's 73kg categories, respectively. Weightlifters Sanket Sargar and Bindyarani Devi won silver medals in men's and women's 55kg categories. Weightlifter Gururaja Poojary has won a bronze medal in the men's 61kg category at CWG.

301.title: Not sure of economy in future but currently we're not reducing staff: Google
301.article_body: In a meeting with employees, Google CEO Sundar Pichai was asked about potential layoffs in the company. Pichai handed the question to the company’s Chief People Officer, Fiona Cicconi. She replied, "We're asking teams to be more focused and efficient...Even though we can't be sure of the economy in the future, we're currently not looking to reduce Google's overall workforce."

302.title: 2 men get into Delhi man's car, steal his wallet; he hits them with SUV
302.article_body: Two men entered another man's car in Delhi and threatened him before stealing his wallet and running away. The man chased the thieves, who were on a bike, and hit them with his SUV to stop them. However, reports said that they fell on the road, abandoned their bike and ran away on foot. Police arrested the accused next day.

303.title: Musi river being used for unlawful enterprises: BJP's Kishan Reddy
303.article_body: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy, who visited the areas affected by flood in Musi river, said that TRS had long ago announced the formation of a corporation to carry out development works along the Musi river's course but nothing happened. He further claimed that people have been using the river for unlawful enterprises and locals have continued to face hardships.

304.title: Person shoots handgun into crowd during brawl in US; 7 injured
304.article_body: Seven people were injured after a person started shooting a handgun into a crowd during a large brawl in Orlando in US' Florida on Sunday, police said. The incident occurred around 2.22 am when the restaurants and bars were closing, the city's Police Chief said. All the injured persons were hospitalised and are in stable condition, police added.

305.title: Cost of 19-kg LPG cylinder cut by ₹36, new price list in different cities released
305.article_body: The price of a 19-kg LPG cylinder has been slashed by ₹36 with effect from Monday. From today, a 19-kg commercial cylinder will cost ₹1,976 in Delhi, ₹1936.50 in Mumbai, ₹2,095.50 in Kolkata and ₹2,141 in Chennai. However, the price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder remained unchanged.

306.title: 10 killed, several injured after vehicle gets electrocuted in West Bengal
306.article_body: Ten people were killed and several others were injured after the vehicle that they were travelling in got electrocuted in West Bengal's Cooch Behar on late Sunday night. Preliminary inquiry stated that the electrocution might have been due to wiring of the generator (DJ system) which was fitted at the rear of the vehicle, police said.

307.title: Sanjay Raut hugs mother before leaving for ED office, video surfaces
307.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut hugging his mother before the Enforcement Directorate officials took him from his Mumbai home to their office. Raut, 60, was arrested after over six hours of questioning by the ED in a money laundering case linked to alleged irregularities in the redevelopment of a Mumbai 'chawl'.

308.title: Hope he gets time to watch a film now: PM Modi as 20-yr-old Achinta wins CWG gold
308.article_body: After weightlifter Achinta Sheuli bagged India's third gold at Commonwealth Games 2022, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "I also hope he gets time to watch a film now that a medal has been won." PM Modi shared a video of his interaction with the 20-year-old before he left for CWG, wherein he pointed out that Achinta is fond of watching movies.

309.title: ED arrests Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in alleged money laundering case in Mumbai
309.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut was arrested by Enforcement Directorate on Sunday night, after hours of questioning in relation with alleged money laundering linked to redevelopment of a Mumbai chawl. ED had detained Raut after conducting a search for over nine hours at Raut's Bhandup residence on Sunday. He will be produced before a court at 11.30 am on Monday.

310.title: Achinta Sheuli lifts record 313 kg, wins India's 3rd gold medal at CWG 2022
310.article_body: Weightlifter Achinta Sheuli bagged India's third gold at CWG 2022 after lifting a total of 313 kg in men's 73-kg category. With this, the 20-year-old set a new Commonwealth Games record. He lifted 143 kg in snatch event and 170 kg in clean and jerk event. All of India's six medals at CWG 2022 so far have come from weightlifting.

311.title: India record their biggest victory in men's hockey in Commonwealth Games history
311.article_body: India on Sunday opened their campaign in men's hockey at Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 with an 11-0 victory against Ghana in a Pool B match. It is India's biggest victory in the history of Commonwealth Games. Harmanpreet Singh scored a hat-trick in the match, while Jugraj Singh scored a brace.

312.title: Historic Kargil War post, which Captain Batra helped capture, renamed 'Gun Hill'
312.article_body: The historic Kargil War post Point 5140, located at Drass, has been renamed 'Gun Hill', a defence spokesman said on Saturday. Point 5140 was the highest enemy-occupied post during the war and Captain Vikram Batra had led from the front to capture it. The capture was a key factor in the early completion of Kargil War operations.

313.title: Jeremy put CWG gold medal as phone wallpaper when design got released, bagged gold today
313.article_body: India's 19-year-old weightlifter Jeremy Lalrinnunga, who bagged India's second gold at CWG 2022 today, had put a picture of CWG gold medal as his phone wallpaper in May when the design got released. "It's something I did before the Youth Olympics in Buenos Aires and I followed the same for Birmingham," Jeremy said. Jeremy also set a CWG record today.

314.title: NASA shares largest-ever pic of a neighbouring galaxy with 100 mn stars in view
314.article_body: NASA has shared the largest-ever image of the Andromeda galaxy, which is the nearest major galaxy to the Milky Way where the Earth is located. Sharing the picture on Instagram, NASA said it showed over 100 million stars across a 48,000-light-year-long stretch of the galaxy. The picture was captured by the Hubble Space Telescope seven years ago.

315.title: ED seizes ₹11.50 lakh unaccounted cash from Sanjay Raut's home: Reports
315.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) reportedly seized unaccounted cash worth ₹11.50 lakh from Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's Mumbai home during a raid on Sunday. He was taken to the ED office in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case. "Sanjay Raut won't be cowed down. I will not leave the party," the party MP said.

316.title: Russia says drone attack on its naval command in Crimea injured 6
316.article_body: The headquarters of Russia's Black Sea fleet in Crimea's Sevastopol came under a drone attack on Sunday, the country said. As per Russian authorities, six personnel were injured in the attack on the naval command. Russian officials believe that a commercial drone was used for the attack. The local mayor has accused "Ukrainian nationalists" of carrying out the strike.

317.title: Gujarat sees drop in daily COVID-19 tally with 942 cases on Sunday
317.article_body: Gujarat saw a decline in its daily COVID-19 caseload as the state recorded 942 fresh cases on Sunday after logging 1,012 cases on the previous day, the state health department informed. No fatalities due to the infection were recorded on Sunday, the department said. As per the health department, Gujarat's active case count now stands at 6,537.

318.title: Indian mixed relay team finishes 10th in triathlon event at CWG 2022
318.article_body: India finished 10th out of 12 in the mixed relay team triathlon event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Sunday. India were 15:03 minutes behind gold medal winner England, who finished in 1:16:40. The Indian quartet of Adarsh Muralidharan Nair Sinimol, Pragnya Mohan, Vishwanath Yadav and Sanjana Sunil Joshi clocked 1:31:43 in the three event competition.

319.title: Happy to contribute to team's win: Smriti on match-winning fifty vs Pak Women
319.article_body: After hitting a match-winning half-century against Pakistan Women in second Group A match at CWG 2022, India Women opener Smriti Mandhana said she was happy to contribute to the team's victory. Mandhana scored a 42-ball 63*. Her knock included eight fours and three sixes. "This first win at CWG feels special," she added. India won by eight wickets on Sunday.

320.title: We won quickly: Harmanpreet on India Women's 8-wicket win vs Pak Women at CWG
320.article_body: Following India Women's eight-wicket win against Pakistan Women in their second match of Group A at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Sunday, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said, "There were a lot of positives today and we'll try to continue this ahead." She added, "It's important to perform as a unit, we had a good start today and won quickly."

321.title: Judges needs to shed resistance to social media: Justice Chandrachud
321.article_body: Supreme Court Judge Justice DY Chandrachud said judges and judiciary have to "shed their fear" of adopting modern means of communication in order to reach out to the masses. "The judicial system cannot be left behind if we're to be the harbinger of change," he said. We can reach out to citizens by using the language of discourse, he added.

322.title: 5G rollout expected to start in October: Ashwini Vaishnaw
322.article_body: Electronics and Information Technology Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Saturday said the rollout of 5G spectrum is expected to start in October and within a year or two, it should have significant presence in India. "We have already told industry that they should act fast after allocation in order to...roll out services soon...The 5G spectrum auction is doing well," he added.

323.title: Jharkhand is a den of corruption: BJP after arrest of 3 Cong MLAs
323.article_body: Jharkhand has become a "den of corruption", the BJP alleged on Sunday, criticising Congress over the arrest of its three MLAs in West Bengal with a large amount of cash. The entire Congress leadership, be it a big leader or small, is involved in corruption in the state, BJP spokesperson Syed Zafar Islam alleged.

324.title: Agri Infra Fund to aid SMBs in getting loans to buy startup drones
324.article_body: The Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF) backed by the government of India will facilitate loans to small and medium businesses and individuals to buy agri-drones. The drones will be the Kisan Drones built by startup Garuda Aerospace. A single loan can be up to ₹10 lakh with 5% interest depending on the drones and accessories purchased.

325.title: India can get own Elon Musk if ISRO challenges are overcome: ISRO chief
325.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) chief S Somanath said that India can get its own Elon Musk if certain limitations and challenges of the organisation are overcome. Stating that ISRO isn't a business-centric organisation, he said that while there is knowledge of product development, they don't know how to make money. He added that application-centric space startups are needed.

326.title: More suspects detained over threat calls to Haryana MLAs
326.article_body: Haryana Police on Sunday informed that a few more suspects have been detained in connection with the threat and extortion calls purportedly made to five-six MLAs of the state in recent months. "We traced their footprints in Mumbai. Maharashtra Police was contacted," a senior police official said. "Several mobile phones, SIM cards, ATM cards were recovered," the official added.

327.title: LeT terrorist planning Amarnath Yatra attack held in J&K's Aloosa
327.article_body: A Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist was arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Aloosa forest in a joint operation by 26 Assam Rifles, Jammu and Kashmir Police and the CRPF. During the search, war-like stores were recovered from him, the Indian Army said. The terrorist's aim was to cause "major disruption during Amarnath Yatra" and carry out attacks on security forces, the army said.

328.title: Visit railway stations linked to India's freedom struggle: PM Modi
328.article_body: During his 'Mann Ki Baat' address, PM Narendra Modi said that many railway stations in the country are rich in history and asked people to visit them. Through the 'Azadi Ki Railgadi Aur Railway Station' initiative, 75 stations linked to the freedom struggle are being decked up. He requested teachers to visit such stations and explain their relevance to students.

329.title: Many areas cleared of militancy in J&K: LG Manoj Sinha
329.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's LG Manoj Sinha said that many areas in the Union Territory have been cleared of militancy while efforts are on to eradicate it. Sinha said that narco-terrorism is emerging as the biggest challenge and can take the shape of cancer if not dealt with. Militancy can be eradicated if all "tools supporting it" are destroyed, he added.

330.title: Remove Singur Andolan chapter, Partha's name from history books: BJP
330.article_body: BJP National Secretary Anupam Hazra has urged West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to remove former minister Partha Chatterjee's name and the 'Singur Andolan' chapter from school books. He said the new generation will start considering him as equivalent to Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose and Khudiram Bose after seeing his name on the pages of the book.

331.title: ISIL-K seeks to recruit members from other terror groups: UN report
331.article_body: The Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant-Khorasan (ISIL-K) seeks to recruit fighters from other terror outfits to amplify its capabilities, a UN report has said. The UN report added that it would prove difficult for the Taliban to reverse ISIL-K's gains if the group manages to regain control over its lost territories in eastern Afghanistan.

332.title: Taiwan not on Pelosi's Asia tour itinerary released by her office
332.article_body: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi's office has released a statement listing the Asian countries the congressional delegation led by her would be visiting starting Sunday. The itinerary, however, does not mention Taiwan. It was heavily speculated that Pelosi would visit Taiwan during the trip. The delegation will visit Singapore, Malaysia, South Korea and Japan, Pelosi's office said.

333.title: 1 dead in clash between Taliban, Iranian forces: Afghan official
333.article_body: The Afghan side registered at least one death after a cross-border clash broke out between Afghan Taliban and Iranian border guards on Sunday, an Afghan police official said. The cause of the clash is unclear, the official added. The skirmish occurred after Taliban forces tried to raise their flag "in an area which is not Afghan territory," Iranian media reported.

334.title: 5.5 magnitude earthquake strikes Nepal, no casualties reported
334.article_body: A 5.5 magnitude earthquake hit Nepal during Sunday early morning hours, the country's National Earthquake Monitoring and Research Centre confirmed. The agency located the epicentre of the earthquake approximately 147 km east-southeast of Kathmandu, the national capital. The epicentre was estimated to be at a depth of 10 km. No immediate casualties or damages due to the earthquake were reported.

335.title: It cost India a couple of World Cups: Shastri on not having anyone who could bowl in top 6
335.article_body: Talking about failing to win a World Cup during his tenure, Ravi Shastri said, "I...always wanted a guy who could bowl in the top 6 and with Hardik Pandya getting injured...it became a massive problem." He added, "It cost India a couple of World Cups." Shastri stated, "We didn't have anyone who could bowl in...top six...That was a liability."

336.title: Tamil Nadu sees drop in daily COVID-19 cases with 1,903 new cases
336.article_body: Tamil Nadu added 1,903 fresh cases to its COVID-19 tally on Monday, PTI reported. The state witnessed a decline in the daily caseload on Monday as 1,945 new infections were recorded on the previous day. As per available data, the active cases in the state also went down from 15,409 on Sunday to 15,093 on Monday.

337.title: Russia claims it destroyed HIMARS ammunition depot in Ukraine
337.article_body: Russia on Monday claimed that its forces destroyed an ammunition storage facility for the US-made HIMARS rocket systems in Ukraine. Russian Defence Ministry said that the said facility was located in the Khmelnytskyi region's Bogdanovtsy. Earlier on Friday, Kremlin claimed to have destroyed four HIMARS launchers in Ukraine between July 5-July 20. The claim was refuted by Kyiv and Washington.

338.title: Haryana Police apprehend inter-state drug smuggler from Panipat
338.article_body: An inter-state drug smuggler from Panipat was arrested by the Haryana Police and they recovered one kg of smack from his possession. The accused, identified as Nityanand, is a resident of Nalanda in Bihar and it was revealed that he smuggled smack from the Northeast for supply in Haryana and Punjab. A case has been registered against him.

339.title: ED raids Church of South India headquarters over medical seat scam
339.article_body: The ED on Monday conducted raids at the headquarters of the Church of South India (CSI) diocese in Thiruvananthapuram and several other locations linked to the church. The raids were in connection with the cases filed against the diocese for allegedly promising seats to students in the CSI's Somervell Memorial Medical College in exchange for huge amounts of money.

340.title: Muhammad Ali's world title belt from 'Rumble in the Jungle' sells for nearly ₹50 crore
340.article_body: The World Boxing Council (WBC) heavyweight title belt won by Muhammad Ali following his 'Rumble In The Jungle' bout with George Foreman in 1974 has been sold for $6.18 million (nearly ₹50 crore) at an auction. Jim Irsay, the CEO of NFL team Indianapolis Colts, won the bid. The belt will be displayed on August 2 at Chicago's Navy Pier.

341.title: Actor David Warner, who featured in 'Titanic', passes away aged 80
341.article_body: British actor David Warner, who featured in 'Titanic', has passed away aged 80 due to a cancer-related illness. Warner played Billy Zane's sidekick Spicer Lovejoy in 'Titanic'. He also starred in films such as 'The Omen' and 'Tron'. His first on-screen credit was in 1962 and his career spanned six decades.

342.title: Several killed in 'targeted' mass shooting in Canada, say police
342.article_body: An early morning mass shooting in Canada's  British Columbia left multiple people dead, police said on Monday. The victims were homeless and police believe the attack was targeted, reports said, adding that one person has been taken into custody. Emergency alerts about "multiple shooting scenes" in downtown Langley were issued shortly after 06:00 local time.

343.title: Swiggy delivery partners protest in Bengaluru over rate changes
343.article_body: Swiggy delivery workers staged a protest in Bengaluru against the recent changes made by the company in per kilometre rates, incentives, long-distance deliveries, and a reduction in surge pay. United Food Delivery Partner's Union (UFDPU) lent their support to the 'log-off' protests. Per kilometre pay was reduced from ₹7 to ₹5, a release from the Union stated.

344.title: SC issues notice to MS Dhoni in arbitration proceedings against Amrapali group
344.article_body: The Supreme Court has stayed arbitral proceedings initiated by ex-India captain MS Dhoni against Amrapali group of companies, now a defunct real estate firm for which Dhoni was the brand ambassador, over some financial dispute. Issuing a notice to Dhoni, the apex court requested Justice Veena Birbal "to hold her hands" and not proceed with the arbitration.

345.title: Karthik won the game, not fond memories: Smith on India's 1st-ever T20I vs SA
345.article_body: Recalling India's first-ever T20I match against South Africa in December 2006, ex-South Africa captain Graeme Smith, who led the team in Johannesburg, said Dinesh Karthik scoring runs and winning the game for India aren't "fond memories". Karthik was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 31*(28). India won by six wickets on the penultimate ball of the match.

346.title: 9 policemen among 21 people rescued from J&K's flash floods
346.article_body: Nine policemen were among 21 people who were rescued from flash floods in the Kathua and Poonch districts of Jammu and Kashmir, according to officials. Flash floods entered a police post in the Chakan-da-bagh area on the Line of Control in Poonch, which resulted in nine policemen being trapped. The policemen took shelter on the rooftop of the police post.

347.title: Rohit Sharma tweets in Gujarati while praising Axar Patel for his match-winning knock
347.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma, who was rested for ODI series against West Indies, took to Twitter to praise Axar Patel and Team India for their victory against West Indies in the second ODI. He wrote, "Woah...that was some performance from Team India last night. Bapu...badhu saru che...(Everything is good)....Axar." Responding to him, Axar wrote, "Badhu saru che Rohit bhai...thanks...Cheers."

348.title: Assam Tourism Minister reviews flood situation in Barak Valley
348.article_body: Jayanta Mallabaruah, Assam's Tourism and PHED Minister, on Monday reviewed the flood situation in Barak Valley during his three-day visit there. During his visit, the minister also reviewed the relief measures being provided to the affected people. Additionally, he also instructed officials of the Water Resources Department to take necessary steps to avoid further flood-like situations.

349.title: Keeping option of coming out of retirement open for 1st women's IPL: Mithali
349.article_body: Ex-India Women captain Mithali Raj said she might consider coming out of retirement to play in the inaugural edition of women's IPL. "There are a few more months to go before the women's IPL happens. It would be lovely to be part of the first edition," she added. Mithali announced retirement from all formats of the game last month.

350.title: Unmarried Chinese woman seeking to freeze her eggs loses court case
350.article_body: An unmarried woman in China who sued a Beijing hospital in 2019, accusing it of refusing to freeze her eggs due to her marital status, has lost the case in court. The Chaoyang District People's Court in Beijing said in its judgement last week that hospital hadn't violated the woman's reproductive rights. The woman has planned to appeal the verdict.

351.title: Y Combinator-backed Better Opinions raises $2.5 mn in seed round
351.article_body: Event-based trading platform, backed by Y Combinator, Better Opinions has raised $2.5 million in its seed round. The round saw participation from investors, including Metaplanet VC and Goldwater Capital along with Y Combinator, Taurus VC, Original Capital, Tremis Capital, Super Capital, and other angel investors. The company has over 6,00,000 users who have traded over ₹10 crore on the platform.

352.title: India and Bangladesh discuss liberalisation of visa procedures
