352.article_body: India and Bangladesh on Monday agreed for a more intensive implementation of provisions under the Revised Travel Arrangements of 2018 relating to tourist, student and business visas. During the third India-Bangladesh Consular dialogue held in Dhaka, both countries agreed for further liberalisation of visa procedures and entry and exit norms to enhance ease of travel.

353.title: Uttarakhand CM pays tribute to Indian Army on Kargil Vijay Diwas
353.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami paid tribute to the soldiers who laid down their lives for the country on Kargil Vijay Diwas. In his statement, Dhami said, "The whole world believes in the indomitable courage and valour of the Indian Army." Dhami added that the Indian Army has always raised the honour of the country.

354.title: Opposition is keeping political interests above country: PM Modi
354.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday accused the Opposition of obstructing development works, saying they keep their political interests above that of the country. He further said that the opposition parties couldn't implement decisions taken by them when they were in power. "Now if [decisions] are implemented, they oppose it. People of the country don't like it," PM Modi added.

355.title: Police arrest 6 criminals who were planning a murder in Jalandhar
355.article_body: Police have arrested six people with prior history of criminal offences with arms and ammunition in a raid in Jalandhar's Goraya district. Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP), Jalandhar Rural, Swarandeep Singh said that the accused were planning to kill a local sarpanch's nephew. A case has been registered under Section 115 of the Indian Penal Code.

356.title: Kanwariyas showered with flowers from helicopter by top UP officials; video surfaces
356.article_body: Senior officials showered flower petals on kanwariyas from a helicopter in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut on Monday. A video shows Inspector General Range Praveen Kumar and DM Deepak Meena showering the flowers on them. The Kanwar Yatra is being taken out after a gap of two years after it was suspended due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

357.title: Meghalaya BJP's Marak framed in prostitution case: State BJP chief
357.article_body: After a case was registered against Meghalaya BJP's state Vice-president Bernard N Marak for allegedly running a prostitution racket in Tura, the party's state President Ernest Mawrie asked that all charges be withdrawn, calling the case politically motivated. Condemning the raid, Mawrie requested the government to protect Marak's life. He added that Marak has been unjustly framed and maligned.

358.title: MP family performs last rites on road, claims no crematorium in village
358.article_body: Residents of Madhya Pradesh's Ajnaul village performed the last rites of a person in the middle of a road alleging that they have no crematorium in the village. Family members of the deceased said, "The incessant rains have filled our fields...We were left with no option." The villagers claimed that the families perform last rites in their own fields.

359.title: Centre devaluing Opp'n: Venugopal on Kharge's seat at President’s oath ceremony
359.article_body: Congress MP KC Venugopal stated that the way Centre treated Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge at the President's oath ceremony was not acceptable. "It is clearly devaluing the position of the Leader of Opposition," he added. Opposition parties wrote to Rajya Sabha Chairman saying Kharge was made to sit in a seat "not commensurate with [his] position".

360.title: India spent ₹15,000 cr on roads near China border in 5 yrs: Centre
360.article_body: Centre told Rajya Sabha on Monday that India has spent ₹15,477 crore on construction of all-weather roads near the India-China border over the last five years. The BRO aims to complete 61 strategic roads assigned to it along the China border by end of this year, officials said. India and China recently held the 16th round of corps commander-level talks.

361.title: Want to be the first woman to play for India after having a baby: Cricketer Sneha Deepthi
361.article_body: Cricketer Sneha Deepthi, who made her India debut aged 16 years in 2013 and was later dropped, said she wants to be the first woman to play for India after having a baby. Sneha, who's now a mother-of-one, said, "That's how in India...things will change." The 25-year-old returned to domestic cricket in 2021-22, eight months after having a baby.

362.title: Europe returnee confirmed as Japan's first monkeypox case
362.article_body: Japan reported its first monkeypox case on Monday in the capital city of Tokyo. The city's Governor Yuriko Koike informed that a man with a travel history to Europe was found to be infected with the virus. The patient, in his 30s, is currently hospitalised, Koike said. WHO on Saturday declared the current monkeypox outbreak as a global health emergency.

363.title: Urged IOA to immediately arrange for accreditation of Lovlina's coach: Sports Ministry
363.article_body: The Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports has urged the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) to immediately arrange for the accreditation of the coach of boxer Lovlina Borgohain for Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. This comes after the Olympic bronze medallist tweeted that her coach is not being allowed to enter the CWG village and it is hampering her training.

364.title: Chinese Prez congratulates Murmu, says 'will work with her to handle differences'
364.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has congratulated the newly-elected President of India Droupadi Murmu and said that he's ready to work with her to "properly handle differences", reports said on Monday. Jinping said he will collaborate with Murmu to "push bilateral ties forward on the right track". He said he attaches "great importance to China-India relations", Chinese agency Xinhua reported.

365.title: Monkeypox transmission seems to be through physical contact: WHO official
365.article_body: WHO South-East Asia Regional Director Dr Poonam Singh has stated that the transmission of monkeypox appears to be occurring primarily through close physical contact including sexual contact. She said that transmission can also occur from contaminated materials such as linens, bedding, electronics and clothing that have infectious skin particles. India has reported four cases of monkeypox so far.

366.title: South Korea records 35,883 fresh COVID-19 cases
366.article_body: South Korea on Monday reported 35,883 fresh cases of COVID-19, taking its tally of total cases to 19,247,496, according to its health authorities. The country logged 65,433 new cases on the previous day. The decline in the daily caseload was due to lower testings over the weekend, Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency suggested.

367.title: Bus falls 40 metres into a river valley in Kenya, 34 reported dead
367.article_body: A bus in Kenya's Tharaka Nithi County veered off a bridge and fell 40 metres into a river valley killing 34 of its occupants on Sunday, local media reported. Speaking about the fatalities, an official said, "Up to now, we have lost 14 women, 18 men and two girls." The official added, "We have rescued 11 who are undergoing treatment."

368.title: Lionel Messi's chapter at Barcelona is not over: President Laporta
368.article_body: Barcelona President Joan Laporta said Lionel Messi's "chapter" at the club is "not over" and considers the club's responsibility to ensure the Argentine has a "more beautiful ending" at Camp Nou. "To Barca, he's been possibly its greatest player, the most efficient," he added. Messi left Barcelona for PSG last year when the club couldn't afford to renew his contract.

369.title: We need to stay alert, devoid of stigma: WHO Regional Director amid monkeypox
369.article_body: The Regional Director of World Health Organisation (WHO) South-East Asia Region Dr Poonam K Singh has stated that we need to stay alert and be prepared to roll out an intense response to curtail the spread of monkeypox. She further said that while doing this, our efforts and measures should be sensitive and devoid of stigma and discrimination.

370.title: European Union approves smallpox vaccine for use against monkeypox
370.article_body: The European Commission has approved the use of Bavarian Nordic's Imvanex vaccine for the treatment of monkeypox. This comes after the European Medicines Agency (EMA) recommended the use of the vaccine to treat monkeypox, which had been previously approved to only treat smallpox in the EU. The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared the monkeypox outbreak a global health emergency.

371.title: Bolsonaro launches election campaign for 2nd term as Brazil Prez
371.article_body: Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro on Sunday officially launched his election campaign for a second term as the country's leader. Bolsonaro was nominated as the presidential candidate of the right-wing Liberal Party in the presence of around 10,000 supporters. Survey shows Bolsonaro trailing behind leftist leader Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva in the October 2 first-round vote.

372.title: 19-yr-old Alcaraz becomes youngest men's tennis player since Nadal to enter top 5
372.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz, a 19-year-old Spanish tennis player, has become the youngest to reach the top five of the men's world rankings since Rafael Nadal. Alcaraz entered the top five at the age of 19 years, 2 months and 20 days. Nadal had entered the top five on May 9, 2005, aged 18 years, 11 months and 6 days.

373.title: 3 dead, 15 hospitalised due to food poisoning in Rajasthan ashram
373.article_body: Three people died and around 15 were hospitalised over suspected food poisoning at the Apna Ghar Ashram in Rajasthan's Kota, officials said. The incident came to light after some people started vomiting while some others did not wake up on Monday morning. District Collector Om Prakash Bunkar has said that food and water samples are being collected for investigations.

374.title: Be more sensitive to differently-abled, rape survivors: Allahabad HC judges
374.article_body: Allahabad High Court judges said that Uttar Pradesh District Court judges should be more sensitive towards differently-abled and rape survivors. This was said as part of a conference on 'Sensitisation of District Court Judges on Gender Justice and Differently-Abled Victims/Survivors of Sexual Abuse'. Constitution does not make a revolution but it is revolutions that make a Constitution, they said.

375.title: Once I retire, I plan to catch up with all the alcohol I missed out on: Ruud
375.article_body: Following his ninth title in Gstaad, world number six Casper Ruud said there's not too much time to celebrate. "But I always told myself that whenever, some day, my career is done, I can catch up with all the alcohol I've been missing, for 17-18 years," he jokingly added. "I don't really drink too much alcohol," Ruud further said.

376.title: Ex-Meta employees raise $150 mn for their crypto venture Aptos Labs
376.article_body: Aptos Labs, a startup co-founded by ex-Meta employees Mo Shaikh and Avery Ching who worked on Meta's crypto project, has raised $150 million in new funding, Aptos announced. The funding round more than doubled Aptos' previous valuation, which was over $1 billion in March 2022. Founded less than a year ago, Aptos raised $200 million in its last funding round.

377.title: India issues statement after civilians killed in Iraq in alleged Turkish air raids
377.article_body: India has "strongly condemned" the recent killing of eight civilians, including two children, in northern Iraq in alleged air raids by Turkey on July 20. In a statement issued by Ministry of External Affairs, India said the killing "is a clear violation of [Iraq's] sovereignty and a blatant disregard for international humanitarian law". Turkey has denied responsibility for the attack.

378.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
378.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states. The IMD has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall over Himachal Pradesh, Assam, Uttarakhand and Arunachal Pradesh on July 28 and 29. It also stated that fairly widespread light to moderate rainfall is likely over Rajasthan, Punjab and Haryana across the next four days.

379.title: Told Ranbir I'll be upset if I don't produce his directorial debut: Alia
379.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who has produced her upcoming film 'Darlings', has said that she has discussed producing a film directed by her husband actor Ranbir Kapoor. "I actually told him that if you don't make me produce it, I'll be very upset!" she said. In an earlier interview, Ranbir had said that he wrote a story during the lockdown.

380.title: Can't tolerate the question: Alia on question about Ranveer being trolled for posing nude
380.article_body: On being asked about her reaction on actor Ranveer Singh getting trolled for his nude photoshoot, Alia Bhatt said, "I can't tolerate the question." Ranveer was recently trolled by a section of social media users over his nude photoshoot for Paper magazine. Calling Ranveer her favourite, Alia said that she doesn't like anything negative being said about him.

381.title: I have faced criticism due to my dusky skin tone: Ruchira Singh
381.article_body: Actress Ruchira Singh has revealed that she has faced criticism due to her dusky skin tone. The actress further said that her journey to showbiz was full of hardships. "I gave hundreds of auditions and got rejected many times, but I feel...one should be ready to face this if they wish to make it big in the industry," she added.

382.title: ₹14,820 cr tax demand raised under black money law on foreign income
382.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said the Centre has raised a tax demand of ₹14,820 crore after completing assessment in 368 cases under the black money law dealing with undisclosed foreign income. Sitharaman said 648 disclosures involving undisclosed foreign assets worth ₹4,164 crore were made in the one-time three months compliance window. The window had closed in September 2015.

383.title: Govt trying to intimidate us by suspending our MPs: Congress
383.article_body: Congress on Monday said that the government was trying to "intimidate" it and asserted that the party will not be cowed down. The remark came after Manickam Tagore, TN Prathapan, Jothimani and Ramya Haridas were suspended from the Lok Sabha for displaying placards raising the issues of rising prices of gas cylinders and imposition of GST on essential items.

384.title: Musetti wastes 5 championship points before winning 1st ATP title in Hamburg
384.article_body: Italy's 20-year-old Lorenzo Musetti wasted five championship points in second set of Hamburg European Open final before defeating top seed Carlos Alcaraz 6-4, 6-7(6-8), 6-4 to win his maiden title on Sunday. "For me, it's a dream. Obviously, I always dreamed about winning a title and I didn't have any chances before," said Musetti. It was Musetti's first tour-level final.

385.title: BJP can't break TMC by using central agencies: Mamata on Partha's arrest
385.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said BJP can't break Trinamool Congress (TMC) with the help of central agencies. Commenting on the arrest of West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, Banerjee said, "If anyone is found guilty, he/she must be punished. But I condemn the malicious campaign against me." She added, "Truth must come out but within a time frame."

386.title: Article 370 was a psychological barrier in India's integration: BJP
386.article_body: National President of BJP Yuva Morcha Tejasvi Surya on Monday said that Article 370 was a cultural and psychological barrier to India's integration. Kashmir is done with terrorism and is on the path of development after the abrogation of Article 370, Surya said. "When Article 370 was there, the youths of Kashmir were bereft of any opportunities," he said.

387.title: Sri Lankan court imposes overseas travel ban on 6 anti-govt protesters
387.article_body: A Sri Lankan court on Monday imposed an overseas travel ban on six protesters who were leading anti-government agitations amid economic crisis. The protesters have been part of an anti-government protest movement since April, which led to the removal of the Rajapaksas from all political positions. They were charged with unlawful gathering in June and granted bail after their arrest.

388.title: Confident on England's senior players covering Stokes' loss in ODIs: Buttler
388.article_body: Jos Buttler said he's confident that England's senior players will step up as the ODI team look to cover for the loss of all-rounder Ben Stokes following his retirement from the format. Buttler is still waiting for his first series win as permanent white-ball captain after he replaced Eoin Morgan as skipper following his retirement from international cricket in June.

389.title: Will keep IAEA cameras off till 2015 nuclear deal's revival: Iran
389.article_body: Iran on Monday said that it will keep the cameras installed by UN's atomic watchdog IAEA switched off until the revival of the 2015 nuclear deal, local media reported. Earlier in June, Tehran had informed IAEA about the removal of 27 cameras from Iran's nuclear facilities installed under the deal. Tehran's move came after IAEA passed a resolution criticising Iran.

390.title: I don't support corruption: Bengal CM Mamata after minister Partha's arrest
390.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday said she doesn't support corruption, two days after state minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested by ED in connection with a teacher recruitment scam. "If someone has been involved in wrong activities, none of us will interfere no matter how harsh a verdict they face," she said. Mamata added, "We won't support them."

391.title: Woman thrashes Odia actress Prakruti over alleged affair with her husband, video surfaces
391.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a woman thrashing National Award-winning Odia actress Prakruti Mishra on a street in Bhubaneswar over an alleged affair with her actor-husband Babushaan Mohanty. In the video, the woman can be seen assaulting her husband and Prakruti after seeing them together in a car. The woman can be seen pulling Prakruti's hair in the car.

392.title: Taiwan conducts air raid exercise amid tensions with China
392.article_body: Taiwan on Monday ordered its residents to stay indoors as the country held an air raid exercise amid its ongoing tensions with China. Sirens were sounded off in the afternoon for street evacuation drills in cities and a 'missile alert' message was also sent to residents. China recently warned US of consequences if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan.

393.title: Centre collected ₹7 lakh cr as net taxes in Apr-Jun quarter, up 24% YoY
393.article_body: The Centre's net tax collections in the April-June 2022 quarter were nearly ₹7 lakh crore, up 24% YoY, as per data given by the government in the Lok Sabha. While ₹3.44 lakh crore was collected as indirect tax, ₹3.55 lakh crore was collected as direct tax. The Centre had set ₹19.35 lakh crore as FY23's net tax collection target.

394.title: Axis Bank's net profit nearly doubles to ₹4,125 crore in Q1 FY23
394.article_body: Axis Bank on Monday said its net profit rose 91% YoY from ₹2,160 crore in Q1 FY22 to ₹4,125 crore in Q1 FY23. The bank's net interest income in the April-June quarter grew 21% YoY to ₹9,384 crore while its non-performing assets declined to 2.76% from 3.85% in Q1 FY22. Its core operating profit grew 17% YoY to ₹6,554 crore.

395.title: Home cooking services platform ChefKart raises $2 mn in seed round
395.article_body: ChefKart, a Gurugram-based home cooking services platform, has raised $2 million in a seed funding round. Led by Pravega Ventures and Blume Ventures, the round saw participation from Zomato's Deepinder Goyal, Titan Capital, Cred's Kunal Shah, Tremis Capital, LetsVenture, among others. Founded in 2020, the company aims to solve the problem of the lack of reliable at-home cooking services.

396.title: US-based real estate developer Panattoni to invest $200 mn in India
396.article_body: US-based industrial real estate developer Panattoni will invest $200 million in India to develop four industrial and logistics parks across major cities. The Indian venture, headquartered in Bengaluru, is in talks with land owners to purchase around 250 acres of land in Delhi-NCR, Mumbai, Chennai, Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Pune. The proposed investments include land, construction and other costs.

397.title: IIT-B graduates' content sharing app SuperShare raises $6.5 mn
397.article_body: SuperShare, a content sharing app, has raised $6.5 million from Lachy Groom, Accel India, and Lightspeed in its first funding round. The app, founded by Sagar Modi, an IIT-Bombay graduate, and Advaith Vishwanath, who was a part of Accel's investment team, is currently operating in stealth mode. Content creator Tanmay Bhat, MythPat, among others participated in the funding round.

398.title: Ranveer's nude photoshoot 'hurt women's sentiments', says police complaint
398.article_body: A police complaint has been filed against Ranveer Singh for allegedly "hurting sentiments of women" and 'insulting their modesty' through his nude photoshoot for Paper magazine, an official said. The complaint filed in Mumbai by an NGO office-bearer said, "This act...created shame in the eyes of the women at large." It said that such acts must be "opposed strongly".

399.title: Facing mental harassment ahead of CWG, can't understand how I can focus: Lovlina
399.article_body: Olympic bronze medal-winning Indian boxer Lovlina Borgohain took to Twitter to share she is facing mental harassment ahead of CWG 2022. She stated her coach is not being allowed to enter the Games village in Birmingham, adding that her training has been hampered eight days before her event. She further said she can't understand how she can focus.

400.title: I'll meet gracefully: Kartik on seeing an ex-girlfriend at an award show
400.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, on being asked about something he would never do in a relationship, said he would not "bad mouth and spread rumours". He was further asked how he would react upon meeting an ex-girlfriend at an award show to which the actor responded, "Meet her gracefully." Kartik and Sara Ali Khan dated while shooting 'Love Aaj Kal 2'.

401.title: Medical students walk out amid anti-abortion speech at US university
401.article_body: Dozens of students of the University of Michigan Medical School staged a walkout during a doctor's keynote address on anti-abortion views. The incident took place during the induction ceremony of the university's new students, a video of which has surfaced online. Last month, the US Supreme Court overturned the landmark Roe vs Wade ruling, which made abortion a constitutional right.

402.title: Stano edges Kawano by 1 second to win men's 35km race walk worlds gold
402.article_body: Italy's Massimo Stano won men's 35km race walk at World Athletics Championships on Sunday in a championship record time of 2:23:14, edging Japan's Masatora Kawano by one second. Stano and Kawano battled shoulder-to-shoulder as the leading pair in final 4km but Stano accelerated in final 300m to win the gold medal. Sweden's Perseus Karlstrom won the bronze (2:23:44).

403.title: Harman Baweja, wife Sasha Ramchandani expecting first child: Report
403.article_body: Actor Harman Baweja and his wife Sasha Ramchandani are expecting their first child together, reported Pinkvilla. Quoting a source, the report stated that Sasha is four months pregnant and the baby is expected to arrive in December. The couple got engaged in December 2020 and had an intimate wedding ceremony following Sikh rituals in Kolkata on March 21, 2021.
